Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - I would stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: Janice P
Reviews.Content: Stayed last night and was very happy. Within walking distance of The Princess of Wales venue. (War Horse). The room was clean and and the beds are really comfortable. The room also had a coffee maker and a fridge. The hotel seem fairly new which is nice. Paid $35.00 to park overnight across the street. I think the valet parking at the hotel is around the same amount and you can take your car in and out as needed. Had breakfast in the hotel restaurant this morning. Has a large variety of food and was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, convenient location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: virago7
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night during a brief business trip and found the staff really helpful & friendly. The room was quiet and had all the basic needs -- free wifi, working hair dryer, plenty of towels, nice Neutragena products, and a comfy bed.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice-DURING THE WEEK”
Reviews.Author: montrealtraveller
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this Hilton Garden on Peter street on business many, many times-so when planning a weekend visit with the family I had no hesitation to book- Its well situated, clean and modern and generally a very good value and the Hhnonors perks are good- WOW what a difference during the weekend-instead of business folk and tourists-its packed with club kids and partyers-the staff do their best-but its noisy and the area around the hotel is pretty crazy late in the evening on weekends- I will stay again during the week-but never on a weekend

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Heather M
Reviews.Content: I spent a night here using a wagjag voucher (amazing deal), the hotel was great, nice room, very friendly staff.. loved the free cookies in the lobby! The only issue was that it was VERY NOISY at night having multiple clubs right outside the front doors. We were on the 15th floor and it still carried up and made it hard to sleep. If you are a light sleeper bring ear plugs.. the hotel should just warn people ahead of time or have ear plugs in the rooms as a courtesy. Everything about this hotel was great it's too bad something so negative like this is pretty much out of their control. Restaurant was really good too with great service! I would recommend this hotel but wouldnt stay there again on a night the clubs are open.

Reviews.Title: “Confortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: CoasterWarrior
Reviews.Content: I booked 3 rooms on short notice focusing on being in downtown Toronto. There were other choices, but I am glad this was our choice given how friendly, confortable and relatively inexpensive it was. The service was quite good. Valet parking was expensive, but this is expected in a city like Toronto with limited downtown space. The room was a fairly typical Hilton Garden Inn room, which I like, with great & free high speed access, a fridge that came in very handy and a solid shower and bed. The rooms were warm and comfortable, and the hotel has a small but cozy lobby with a fireplace, business center and small market shop. We could walk to the CN Tower and Skydome as well as many restaurants, and the customers we were calling on were close by, so the location in Toronto was great for us. With these Hilton hotels, I am always pretty certain of what to expect. For downtown Toronto, I recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Monica G
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 6 nights. Comfortable bed, breakfast was ok. Nice view from upper floors. Walking distance to main attractions. There was a door between our room and the next one and we felt a little bit uncomfortable, we could hear our neighbours conversations with no effort and they could do the same.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jeff M Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, excellent value, nice pool and fitness area. My only complaint is that the front desk staff could have been a bit more accommodating. I found them to be a bit rude and difficult to deal with.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Garden Inn has a great location and quiet, clean rooms with a nice breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: EDV1958
Reviews.Content: We had a Wag Jaunt for a 2 day stay this past week for 4 friends ( my 19 yr dtr. and her friend and myself and a friend). We had no trouble getting there - handy to Lakeshore Blvd. Walking distance to so many things to do and see. Cora's is just down the street for lunch. They let us have early check in and late check out. I thought it would be noisy at night when the clubs close but we were on the 9th floor on the east side and did not hear a thing. Breakfast was wonderful- the staff encouraged us to take whatever we wanted to go - with paper bags made available. Nice lobby with fresh cookies in the evening. We would love to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Basic room, try the breakfast buffet”
Reviews.Author: JamesPharm
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at te Hilton Garden Inn to try something different. The lobby is quite lovely, the parking is expensive. Be aware that this is in the club district so be prepared to encounter drunk people on the weekend stumbling about. The room was clean and quite large. We had a room with a stand up shower which was fine by me. I truly disliked the bed. It was an adjustable bed that allows you to choose the softness, I found it to be lumpy and uncomfortable. we enjoyed the pool and hot tub albeit not very deep. There is also a small fitness center. My fav part was the breakfast buffet. The price is very reasonabe and the quality of the food was great. They let you take some take out back to the room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice downtown hotel.”
Reviews.Author: mwav3
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very new and clean and rooms are much larger then the typical downtown hotel. The room was great and had an awesome view of downtown Toronto. There's noise but that's what to expect at any hotel in a major city. Parking was VERY expensive and I parked at a city lot off site. The restuarant has a great breakfast with a lot of options. Location is not too far of a walk from major attractions but the area right around the hotel is mostly offices. If you're staying downtown and don't need the car this is a good option, but for someone who needs to drive around the expense of parking and needing to get the car from a valet can be a hassle.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice property, longest check in ever.”
Reviews.Author: NiagaraBurtons
Reviews.Content: Our check in at this hotel took over an hour on a Saturday afternoon. There were not enough seats in the lobby for the number of guests who were waiting for assistance and it was so crowded there was little sense of one's place in the "line". I clocked two of the groups in front of me at 22 and 16 minutes respectively - who has this kind of time to register for a hotel stay? My own prepaid super easy CC in hand check in also took an unreal 12 minutes. I don't typically times check ins but there wasn't much else to do. It was too crowded to chat with my travel companion about anything of actual interest. As expected no apology for the squishy wait. It's downtown Toronto after all, location will always trump customer service. Room was clean and nice, breakfast was great. I'm sure my timing was a fluke but I'm also sure the front office staff's lack of concern was typical.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but don't expect to get any sleep”
Reviews.Author: teagran
Reviews.Content: I surprised my husband with what I thought would be a relaxing get-away at a lovely downtown Toronto hotel. Sadly, the only thing that "got away" was a good night's sleep. The good: The hotel itself is very nice - front desk staff were pleasant and efficient. Our room (jacuzzi room with fireplace) was very clean and we found the bed to be very comfortable. Free wi-fi was a nice touch. The not so good: Oddly, the jacuzzi kept turning on by itself when it was empty - we had to call down after midnight to the front desk, where they somehow turned it off remotely. (As another reviewer mentioned, the fridge is also quite loud.) The awful: The hotel is surrounded by clubs, which means: loud music, loud talking/shouting as people wait in line to get into the clubs, constant beeping of car horns as people are dropped off/picked up, and finally - RIDICULOUSLY LOUD drunk people stumbling into the street in droves when the clubs close at 3:00am. It was so loud, we had to check to see if our window was actually open (it wasn't). We were very disappointed that the windows were not well insulated against this onslaught of sound. I would expect that a hotel in a club district - especially a hotel with the "Hilton" name - would make every effort to soundproof rooms and protect its guests from this noise. In total, we managed about 3 hours of sleep - definitely not the relaxing "get-away" I had planned. (Note:This was on a SUNDAY night, when one would assume the clubs would not be an issue.) So - while the hotel itself is quite nice, we will not return, and I would not recommend it unless you are an unusually heavy sleeper. Disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Jenny932
Reviews.Content: We stayed on a wag jag jaunt deal and upgraded to a jacuzzi room. We arrived an hour early and the room wasn't available but we were able to leave our bags and have the car parked no problem. The room was lovely, fireplace jacuzzi king sized bed. All very clean, there was a couple of hairs in the tub but everything else was spotless. The bed had a control to change firmness which was neat- overall could have been softer but no complaints. I would recommend staying on a floor higher than 10, I am a light sleeper and woke up at 230-330 AM after the bars let out and there was a lot of noise below! They had set up late checkout for us which was great, very nice to lounge until 1. Only other thing to note would be that the jacuzzi jets randomly turned on a couple of times but it was never when we were sleeping so not a big deal. Overall a positive stay, staff were courteous & friendly and would comeback again.

Reviews.Title: “Good, centrally located hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: markD78
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed here after booking it through a 'deal site'. We live in the Toronto area, and know the area well. It's a good hotel, centrally located. Not too far from downtown, but, far enough to get out of it. YES - it's in the club district. There had been some other reviews that they could hear the noise from the clubs. My wife and I heard nothing. Toronto is a big city, and there will be noise from outside (regular street noise) All in all, I recommend for a night away, or for business. Free wifi, and a business centre. Both pluses. Thank-you Hilton Garden Inn Toronto -

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, very clean, great breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: SusanTO7
Reviews.Content: This hotel is less than 10 minutes walk from the Convention Centre, a dozen clubs and bars, the Eaton Centre, Queen St West shopping district, the Second City, Roy Thomson Hall and more. It's a really great location if you're planning to see a lot of shows and shop. 2nd floor restaurant is great and reasonably priced. The breakfast is excellent, and includes some delicious waffles! The hot made-to-order breakfast is extra. Get a deal to have that included with your stay if you're in to it. The room was very clean, as well as the rest of the building. Water pressure and heat were great. I was impressed with the staff, who were very helpful. This hotel is popular with the party crowd on weekends. Expect late comings-and-goings on club nights. The beds are adjustable (soft to firm) and were very comfortable and warm. Each room has its own thermostat that you can adjust. There are no opaque curtains to close in the room, which can be annoying for people who like to sleep in the pitch dark. Bring a sleep mask if you need it. Very impressed with this hotel. We'll definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Toronto-Retiree
Reviews.Content: We live in Toronto, so don't stay in Toronto hotels very often. However, we had a Jaunt coupon (which also included $50 for hotel expenses) so decided to make an event of it. We were attending a theatre just a 7 minute walk from hotel. The front desk staff were friendly and efficient. The room was large and very clean. The shower was one of the best we have ever had at any hotel *anywhere*. The food at dinner was very good and the breakfast that was included with the room package was excellent. We will stay here again and would recommend this hotel without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: lizw2000
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weekend getaway to Toronto. We had purchased two WagJag Jaunt coupons for $149 a night. That included $50's per day toward any hotel expense as well as the breakfast buffett. The hotel was very clean, room was quite large and shower had good water pressure. (once we figured out how to work all the shower heads) The walls were very thin though-we could really hear our neighbours mini party at 2AM in the morning. This would not be an issue during week with business travellers, but there were many young people around on the weekend. The room had a small fridge, microwave and large TV. The location was excellent, right across the street really from Theatres and Second City Comedy club. We went Friday night and it was quite good! It took almost 30 mintues to walk to Eaton's Centre and just five minutes to Roger's Centre. The restaurant food was excellent-we had chicken stir fry and shrimp pasta. The breakfast buffett was very well stocked and had lots of options. Made to order eggs, french toast, waffles, omlettes, fresh fruit, cereals, selection of pastries, yogurts..you name it. The pool and hot tub looked nice and clean, although we didnn't use it. Definately recommend the property. The front desk staff responded quickly to the noise at 2AM with the room next door.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sol W
Reviews.Content: We stay here often. The staff is pleasant and helpful. The rooms are modern, very clean and have many more amenities than one expects, including fridge, microwave, large HDTV, adjustable bed, spacious bathroom and, if upgrading, a wonderful Jacuzzi. Hot breakfast is on until 11am for (civilized) late sleepers, and offers lots to choose from, all good and very well prepared. The service is great and you must try a croissant - the best.

Reviews.Title: “was very impressed”
Reviews.Author: claudiathebouve
Reviews.Content: my grandaughter has to go to hospital each year so we booked at the hilton , they had overbooked and buy the time we got there had no rooms left, as there was four of us they gave us the penthouse at no extra charge the room was beautifull i was very impressed

Reviews.Title: “I couldn't ask for a better location!”
Reviews.Author: generatorx
Reviews.Content: This was my 1st time in Toronto so maybe there are better locations but I felt everyday we were there we walked in a different direction and found great things to do. Our room also had 2 queens which was nice since I went with a bunch of dudes. Great rates, Great location, friendly staff. Weather you want a night club, pub, strip club, rock bar, resturant, or shopping ... it was all minutes from the door step. What else can you ask for?..... I know... it also came with a fridge and mircowave. : )

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel at a reasonable cost”
Reviews.Author: lovinthebeachgirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a business/pleasure trip. The beds were firm, but comfortable. The check-in process was quick and efficient. The condition of the shared areas and room were very clean and neat. The second floor restaurant area was lovely and the service at breakfast could not have been better. We were very pleased and this hotel will remain with our Toronto file for the next trip.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE BEDS!!!! SO UNCOMFORTABLE”
Reviews.Author: carissa c
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here this past weekend january 21-23 and the people were nice not that we were in the hotel to much other than to sleep but the bed was absolutely awful it was like sleeping on a board. my boyfriend and i both went home sore and dead tired from trying to find a comfortable way to sleep tossing and turning all night but there was none. we were so tired and sore from bad sleep we went home early on monday without shopping or anything the room was kind of plain we had the room with a jacuzzi and fireplace but both nights when we were in bed sleeping the jacuzzi mysteriously turned on and woke us both up and we couldn't figure out how to turn it off. overall the people were nice but because of the uncomfortable bed we would not stay here again. oh and our room had an extremely loud fridge.

Reviews.Title: “Great Birthday”
Reviews.Author: beach_bum6d9
Reviews.Content: REASON FOR MY STAY: Birthday CHECK IN: Smooth and fast. ROOM: this room was big, with a big bed and couch (pullout). The room was very clean and modern. The bed was very comfortable. The only negative thing I would have to say would be regarding the small size of the bathroom. CHECKOUT: very easy and swift. Other Comments: the location is not too far from some great downtown clubs.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Julie4212
Reviews.Content: Hi, I recently stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn on Peter Street on Jan 2nd, 2012 and it was my second time staying at this hotel. The check'in process was great, fast and efficient. We had the room with the whirlpool tub, king size bed and fireplace. Everything was great and loved this room. The only room for improvement was when the heating came on it was a little louder than what I am used to but it didn't make our stay any less enjoyable. I would definitely go back to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Location, value and cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: Lisa3333333333333333
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn for New Years Eve. We chose it because of it's price, location and reviews and we were very happy with our decision. At check in we got to help ourselves to the complimentary cookies which were very delicious. The room was a decent size, but most importantly it was very clean and nicely updated with granite counter tops. There was an ipod dock in the room which was nice to have. Even though we didn't buy them you could buy snacks 24 hours a day which was nice. The climate control in the room worked extremely quickly to change between different temperatures to keep the room as cool or warm as you like it. My only complaint was that there were only two tiny creamers but enough coffee to make 4 cups. It would be great to see more cream in the room in future. Overall we had a fantastic 1 night stay especially since check out time was noon so we could sleep in. I'd definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here...No Doubt About It.”
Reviews.Author: dlynnebrown
Reviews.Content: Christmas 2011 will be one for the books....And it all started with a dream to go to TSO's production of Handel's Messiah. After throrough research online, I decided to book Hilton Garden Inn, Peter Street, Toronto. So glad I did! My mom and I had a fabulous stay there...Essentially, we needed a nice place with a pool and hot tub, quiet clean rooms, at an affordable rate... We had all of that and so much more... The front desk staff, porters, room staff, wereall excellent....When a hotel strives for excellence in costumer service, it shows....it really does... The room was clean and comfortable...So nice to have that special attention from our room staff...thank you! The great space for the pool and whirlpool is , without question, very impressive. Super clean..i mean there wasn't any dust...dirt, smudges...The (glass or plexiglass) partition for whirpool was so clean that it positively sparkled. That was noticeabley stellar clean.. It also has a lift for individuals with disabilities to be able to access the hot tub and pool. The pool itself is just about a perfect size for a downtown hotel...and the water was nice and warm...There really isn't anything more discouraging for a hotel guest than getting ready for the swim, and finding it difficult to get into the pool because the water is too cold...Seems like a little thing, but it's not...This pool was perfect! The whirpool temperature was awesome! We stayed for 2 nights , and spent both evenings at Roy Thompson Hall.... Peter St. intersects with the King Street Car, so we took full advantage of the TTC. A trip to Toronto just isn`t complete without a ride on the Street Car, and a trip on the Subway to Eaton Centre! Wonderful time in Toronto...and it all started with the perfect hotel choice... Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “three stars on the limit, consider it 2 1/2”
Reviews.Author: nikosgeo
Reviews.Content: I'm giving you the facts so you can deside for yourself: The good news: *location - very central and well located near the city's main shopping area, the theaters, the cn tower etc. *nice entrance with a fireplace *room is warm, big enough, well soundproofed. *nice bathroom with puffy towels and easy to use facilities *Fantastic breakfast (the best part of our stay) fresh ingredients, smiley people, cook to make a fresh omelette, etc *Logical cost and value for money (compared to other similar hotels) *If you're from Egypt or in general you're arabic oriented you'll feel more home - as most of the guys who manage the hotel (and most of the customers) are oriented from these countries (north africa, saudi arabia etc). The bad news: *Prices are depended on who you're talking with - i called from Montreal and the receptionist told me that the price is 149$ plus taxes but they have an offer for the two nights for 280$ total cost and that if i wanted a room with jaccuzi the cost would be higher for 50$. When we arrived the same day the receptionist told me that there isn't such an offer and i had to pay the normal price 149$ plus taxes = 168$ per night without breakfast included (plus 17$ per person per day) and as for the jaccuzi option the price was...70$. We didn't care for an option such a jaccuzi but it is interesting that all the numbers increased not only the room price! I was more tired than angry and i paid. *Parking costs 35$ (!) per night. I parked on a small parking 100m/yards from the hotel for 20$ per night (on widmer street ABOVE Adelaide street - not the big one which is UNDER adelaide street these guys are asking also for 35$, there's a small one on the other side 30m from Adelaide. *The quality of sleep (which for me matters for >80%) was bad as the quality of linens was just accepted, worst than any hilton we've ever stayed in and moreover the matress was...BAD not even mediocre. My back was hurting the next morning and i still can't believe that they have this matresses in a Hilton! *Though the rooms are well soundproofed and quiet the noise enemy is...inside the room and it's name is refrigerator! It works much more than the normal (bad placed?) and the motor is very noisy, it wakes you up when it starts and when it stops and just disturbing while working. *As the hotel allows you to take the breakfast in your room (!!!) you will see people on pyjamas (!!) in the elevator holding milk and toasts or carrying fruits and butter and marmelade wearing their flip flops - for sure this is not a Hilton's image. All in all, i'm not saying avoid but also i do not recommend this hotel. Good luck whatever you choose to do in Toronto and enjoy your stay in the city! Thanks for reading my review!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Service”
Reviews.Author: LoriGuelph
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night in early December. It was easy to find from the Gardiner. The valet greeted me right away and said that I could leave my car the next day as long as I wanted. Check in was smooth and the room was small but very clean. I was meeting friends on Queen street and the location was very convenient. Lots of restaurants within a short walking distance. The one negative was weak water pressure in the shower but overall I would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay here and fabulous location... close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: ButtonsH
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a in a great location. Close to everything downtown and the shops and restaurants of Queen St. & King St. W.... within easy walk distance of the theater district as well. Really comfy beds and rooms are a good size. In the bathroom you feel like you are in a space capsule and these are a little cramped but lets face it how much time do you spend in a bathroom...in and out right! Staff great, friendly and efficient. Executive lounge is one of the best of the Hilton chain. Food great and the views spectacular especially at night and they have computers for easy access to the web and e-mail up there. Lobby is great for meeting friends and you can sit and chat there even if you don't want a drink. Will definitely stay here again. We know all the downtown hotels as we used to live in TO before we moved to the US and this hotel has become one of our favorites for visiting downtown TO.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...great value...great comfort!”
Reviews.Author: thriftylil
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in November for a conference at the Metro Convention Centre. 10 minute walk door to door. Booked on-line with no refunds or cancellation so a bit of a risk (but worth it)King room with jaccuzi and fireplace. Large spacious room...comfortable sitting area....wonderful bed for sleeping...and very quiet for being downtown. Wonderful stay...and would recommend it highly! Tip...Room on 9th floor...and actually have a view!

Reviews.Title: “what we needed for a vacay.”
Reviews.Author: bryan e
Reviews.Content: my wife and i were on vacay. and we were out most of the day, we had a bed, tv,shower, toilet, coffee maker, fridge, and a microwave. housekeeping was super here. all of the staff were super friendly. the pool and jacuzzi were awesome after waling around all day. nice fitness room to. the room was perfect, comfy, almost felt like we were home. everything was super clean. good breakfast. the hotel itself was perfect. as most reviewers said, the nightclub is loud. hotel cant help that. what makes is worse is the drunk people returning to there rooms from 12am to 5am. they like to stay there for a night or 2. saturday night i took ny-quil so that i could stay asleep and had no issue that night. the club is the only negative i could find here, and thats only friday and saturday night. makes for a rough nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Best avoided”
Reviews.Author: MKOxon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a perfectly acceptable business style hotel, nicely located in Toronto. What annoys me is that have repeatedly taken money from my credit card account without providing documentation and without discussing or agreeing the amount with me first. They just take the money! I'm not saying the funds weren't due, but the first I knew about it was from my credit card statement. That can't be right. The no documentation makes claiming expenses a nightmare. I won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: ZeinaS
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed staying in this hotel. I only stayed there for one night but the room was very comfortable and clean. The staff was friendly and they did all they could to help us. I particularly loved the breakfast they offer where we have a choice of a continental breakfast for $10 +tx or a buffet (all you can eat) for $15 +tx. The only 2 things I didn't appreciate were out of the control of the hotel: first there is a club right next to the hotel and we could hear the loud music coming from the club late at night (being on the 3rd and 15th floor). Another thing is try to avoid the public parking across the hotel. The man there told us that at the hotel we can park the car for $35 and had to take it out before 1 pm whereas we can park it for $40 in his parking until 3 pm. Then we asked the hotel (after we parked our car in the public parking) and they said that we'd pay $35 until 3 pm!! So it would have been much safer and cheaper to park the car at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, taxis are best at night.”
Reviews.Author: Jim B
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was formerly called Comfort Suites. Each room is large and has a micowave and small fridge, Comfortable and basic. There is a complimentary continental breakfast on the second floor, and the lobby hosts a water feature and comfortable couches and overstuffed chairs for sitting. A front desk is sparcely staffed, a note to another guest was never delivered. It was important. Although the Hotel is close to Eaton Centre and Yonge Street, the actually few blocks around the Hilton Garden is dark and sketchy at night. I would advise a taxi. It is only a three block ride to the Keg Mansion Steakhouse, and their is a Caseys fast food roadhouse joint for baskets of fast food and fries, not the greatest. Right beside the Hilton Gardens is a better Hotel called the Grand all done up in little white lights, but both locations are really off the beaten track. Jarvis Street is not the street to stroll at night. The Hotel suites fine for business travellors and might even have a small conference room . But for a luxtury travellor I would recommend the Royal York Fairmount Toronto, or Harbour Castle, or Four Seasons Yorkville, Hyatt Yorkville or the King Edward. Hilton Gardens is a small place that has recently done a reno, so if you want to be close to everything this location is suitable on the East side of town. Don't expect grandure, it is fairly basic and the fresh flower arrangement in the lobby helps. It will do. Once again, the rooms are larger than one would expect. During Carribana, Pride, and Tiff, expect a lot of noise and book ahead.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, well located, a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: arewetherenow
Reviews.Content: Spent a long weekend here in November and would return. The rooms are in excellent condition, housekeeping is very good, and the location is very handy to everything downtown. I would avoid the restaurant in the hotel as the service is slow and inconsistent. There are literally hundreds of other options nearby. I suggest you ask for a room on a high floor as there is a noisy club South of the hotel on the ground floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: sharonincolorado
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I visited Toronto Oct 8-11. This hotel is very up-to-date with great beds, good-sized rooms, refrigerator and a nice flat screen tv. It's right in the middle of the entertainment district which means you are near everything. Staff was helpful in helping us use mass transit and figure out what was open on Canadian Thanksgiving. Some other folks complained about the noise from the nightclubs in the area. I did hear them but maybe I just expect that city hum, having grown up in NY. Close to lots of restaurants, a Whole Foods and two streetcar lines making it easy to get around. I compared rates here and given the location, this is a good value. Shop for deals on the rate. If you have a car, consider the cost of parking. I found this hotel to have a better rate then others in downtown Toronto (which is not the same as saying it's cheap). Also, wifi/internet is free.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and good location”
Reviews.Author: BruceCalgary
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn Toronto from Oct 15 - 19 for an energy industry course that was being taught at the hotel. The room was spacious, modern and clean and the bed was great - slept like a baby every night. My only complaint about the room is that, like many hotel rooms, the bathroom didn't have a fan. My colleague and I had heard iffy things about the neighborhood in which this hotel is situated. We started to get concerned at some of the surrounding businesses as we pulled up in the taxi, but once settled in, we found the location excellent. Just a few blocks from Yonge Street and the Eaton Centre and walking distance to everything else downtown T.O. has to offer. Quite frankly, the neighborhood really isn't any better or worse than the rest of downtown. We found the front desk staff courteous and helpful from the time we checked in until we left. The fitness centre on the 2nd floor is clean, has modern equipment, and includes a pool/jacuzzi, but overall it's rather small. The pantry off the main desk area is well stocked with various items for purchase (if you're Hilton Honours program member, your bottled water is free). This is a clean, efficient hotel in a good location. At $180/night it's reasonable for the business traveller who wants proximity to downtown T.O. without being in the heart of it. I would stay here again on business, but would probably go with something a little more upscale for a personal visit.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: pmasiello
Reviews.Content: My business associates and I are Diamond, Silver and Gold Hilton honors members and stay at Hiltons all around the world. Never again will I waste money at this property. Over a 2 week period I paid for 10 room nights here with our business. From the check in we were given a hard time because I wanted to pay for all the rooms under 1 card. It took a manager to approve doing it and he only did it under duress. Then we asked 1 special favor. Could you clean a room at 10 so we could have a meeting in it. The service manager refused! Never in my life have I spent so much in one place and been treated so poorly. Too many options in Toronto to waste your money here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and hotel with all you need”
Reviews.Author: mackie123
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business and can definitely say that it has all the basic things required by a business traveller; iron, hairdryer, in room safe, free wi-fi etc. Good size room and extremely comfortable bed. The location is perfect for getting around on foot. Breakfast was good and the staff very friendly. There was a slight mix up with our booking but no fuss was made although I did find the reception staff a little disinterested but nothing to spoil my stay. I was there the morning of the false fire alarm and although it was annoying I would rather it be false than for real! I would be quite happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Unaccommodating & basic hotel for a high price tag”
Reviews.Author: trvlwrldgrl
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here in October 2011 for one night because he was running the Scotiabank Marathon. The price is comparable to most downtown Toronto hotels, so I expected similar service & accommodations. This is not what we received. Here is a list of my complaints: 1. Difficult & unaccommodating customer service: I called to request early check-in a few days before arriving, as I typically do with other hotels. Instead of ensuring I would receive early check-in at my required time, I was told they cannot grant this request in advance & I need to call the morning of my arrival. I did this the morning we were to arrive & they again said they cannot grant this request until I actually arrive at the hotel & they will see if there are any rooms available. I find this lack of customer service very disappointing, considering I have never received such poor treatment at the usual hotels I stay at (Westin, Marriot & InterCon). When we arrived I requested late check-out, since my husband is in the marathon & it is not humanly possible for us to check out at noon. They said I must request this on the morning of check out. To me, this again is VERY unaccommodating, as I have many other tasks that take precedence the morning of a marathon. I consider my request a very standard one & not at all out of the ordinary, however, the Hilton wouldn't grant it. The morning we were scheduled to check-out, I went to the front desk to request late check-out. I was told that was impossible & I must check out at noon or I would be charged a half day room fee. I told them this is disappointing, as we typically stay at the InterCon the night before my husband's marathon & they are more than willing to grant late check-out. Upon hearing this, the clerk granted me a 3 p.m. check out, but made it seem like he was moving mountains for me (eye roll). 2. Fire alarms & other disturbing noise: There was a fire alarm at 7 a.m. for no apparent reason. I checked with the front desk what the issue was & was told it was a false alarm. It would have been nice if they had notified the guests! There is also a lot of street noise surrounding this hotel, as the windows have not been properly insulated against sound. Lastly, there are many mechanical noises within the hotel room itself, from the vent system & fridge. We had to shut everything off in order for my husband to get a decent sleep before his marathon. There was no way, however, to control the street noise, which was very stressful & caused lack of sleep. 3. Parking: We were told to park from noon on Saturday until 3 p.m. on Sunday would cost $70, as this is considered two days of parking. Apparently a new "day" starts at 2 p.m. Clearly this was ridiculous & we parked elsewhere....FOR FREE! 4. Unauthorized credit card charges: Now that I am back home I see my credit card on file has in fact been charged for the "half day room fee" because of my 3 hour late check-out. I was guaranteed at the front desk that I would NOT be charged, but my credit card has been charged $75 without my authorization. I guess I can add fraud to the list of complaints against this hotel?

Reviews.Title: “Sleep-optional hotel”
Reviews.Author: JJJC_Family
Reviews.Content: First, I'll give you the good news. It's a pretty new and attractive property. It's right downtown. The room, itself was quite nice. They had good cookies upon arrival. Now, I'll give you the bad. The hotel is right next to a night club, which we did not know beforehand. We got in on a Saturday about 5PM, went to a quick dinner and then went to Cirque du Soleil's Totem. We were in a good mood as we headed back to the hotel to sleep. When we got out of the car, we saw a large crowd and heard very, very loud music coming from the club. Then we walked to the entrance of the hotel, which is on the narrow alley that separates it from the night club. By the front door, was a guy trying to console a girl whose head was down and appeared to be extremely unhappy. At first, I was scared that he might be threatening to her, but then realized he was concerned that she was so unhappy and not responding to him. Regardless, it was a little disconcerting that they chose to seek refuge right at the entrance of the hotel. What if he truly was violent? OK. Then we went upstairs to our room on the 12th floor. We expected that being so high, we would be immunized against the noise coming from the night club. Wrong! Our room was almost directly across from it and worse they had a patio there from which they belched the music. It was perhaps midnight or later. We hoped to be able to stay, but the intensity of the music was intolerable. Then we realized that the situation was worse then we thought. Very loud music was also coming from the room next door, apparently partying. We called the front desk and explained the situation and a guy came up. He was very nice. He told us that they had called the folks next door and told them they had to be quiet ( we suspected as much, because we heard some very loud and unhappy comments emanating from the room as a result). Unfortunately, he said the hotel could do nothing about the club. I had told the desk and him that we would have to be moved. He understood and said that we were by no means the first people to complain about this aspect of the hotel's location. Indeed, it seemed this was an intractable problem that the staff regularly had to deal with and endure the anger and frustration of guests who could not sleep. He said they would move us to the other side of the building where we would not hear the noise. I thanked him. We moved. Unfortunately, the room they moved us to had only one bed and we had 3 people. It had a sofa bed. I was unhappy, because we had paid for a 2 queen room. He said that all the 2 queen rooms faced the night club and all would have the same noise problem. Both my 87 year old mother and I tried the sofa bed and it was the worst sofabed I had ever seen. It had this extremely thin mattress and it was like sleeping on the metal frame. I told him it was unacceptable and said that they would have to supply a second room so we could all get some sleep. He called down to the front desk and they wanted to bring a second bed up into the room. I wasn't crazy about this, but I said ok, at first. Then I asked if they were intending on taking out the sofa to make room for the bed and they said no. I told him that it would be impossible to get the bed in otherwise and that even with taking the sofa out, it would be impossible to move in the room with the 2nd bed in there. I then demanded that they give a 2nd room and told them that I absolutely expected to not pay for anything for either room as it was now past 1AM and I was so upset that I knew I wouldn't sleep and my 87 year old mother was very upset and incredibly tired. Very reluctantly they got me a 2nd room, but told me I would have to pay for 1 room. I told them that I expected to be comped for everything. I paid for a room where I could get a good night sleep and they had not delivered that. I told them that I had paid for a premium hotel for precisely that reason. They told me they could not control outside noise. I said that was ridiculous, that every city had laws precisely prohibiting disturbing the peace of others and that it was even more ridiculous to have a hotel where they knew guests could not get a good night's sleep. That is the most basic function of a hotel. They said they could not authorize comping the room, that only the manager could do that and that she would not be in until next morning. I informed them that if I was not comped, I would dispute the charge with American Express. Nonetheless, I apologized to them for yelling and told them I realized that there was a limited amount they personally could do. They couldn't physically move the hotel that night and probably their hands were tied re: what they could offer guests. I then went to my room and took a shower. When I went to sleep, I then realized the room was not as quiet as they advertised. I could still hear the music, definitely lower than the other room, but enough to keep me awake. Plus, now I was on the 4th floor and there was lots of street noise from people outside having a good time. Worse, hotel guests came in and made lots of noise as they went back to their rooms. At 3AM, I called the front desk and plaintively asked if the music ever stopped. I was told that it should end by 2:45AM. Apparently, he didn't know what time it was and was a bit flustered when I explained that it was already 3AM. He said the music would end soon. I finally got to sleep at 4AM, as my tiredness and sleeping pill kicked in. Unfortuantely, at 5AM a particularly loud and obnoxious group of guests came in and woke me up. I tried to get back to sleep, but starting around 6AM, guesrs started leaving their rooms either to go to breakfast or check out. Hands down, this was the absolute worst night I endured in any hotel and that is saying a lot, as I have experienced some truly terrible nights before this. I told my wife that she would have to deal with the hotel re: billing, because I would blow my top if I spoke to them. She was told that the manager was not there. She asked them to call her. They said she was in church. She said we would go to breakfast and hoped that they could contact her. They said they would call my wife when they heard from her. Luckily, she agreed to comp the entire bill. Regardless, I wanted a good night sleep. We wanted to go sightseeing and everyone was dead and we did nothing the whole day. Fortunately, we had not purchased tickets for anything or it would have been a further disaster. As it is, it wasted a precious vacation day and the experience left us tired for the next several days. To be honest, I believe that it is possible to have a wonderful time at the hotel, under the right circumstances. However, I would not recommend going to this hotel if you want to be sure you get a good night's sleep. As the desk clerk said, they cannot control outside noise and when the night club is in full swing there is a lot of noise. Nor can they control other guests coming in at all hours of the night making lots of noise as they return to their rooms, probably from partying, themselves. They can control other guests partying and making lots of noise, but that takes calling them and waiting until the guests actually settle down. I hope the hotel finds solutions to these problems, because physically it is a fine property.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton does it right”
Reviews.Author: MimiDot
Reviews.Content: Spent the Thanksgiving weekend at the Hilton Garden Inn on Peter St. A lovely, clean, modern hotel downtown. We arrived early and checked our bags and came back in the evening. Some reviewers had mentioned the noise from the clubs so we asked for a quiet room and were not disappointed. Did not hear a thing the whole time we were there. Wonderful beds and linens. The staff was friendly, helpful and efficient. The pool and spa were much appreciated as was the Marquis dining room where we had a great breakfast in a relaxed atmosphere. This was my second visit to a Hilton Garden Inn and it will not be my last.

Reviews.Title: “locations is good, bad and ugly”
Reviews.Author: Slackbladder
Reviews.Content: If you like nightclubs you'll love this hotel. If you dont then think again. Peter Street is in the entertainment district so only a short walk to theatres, the baseball and the CN tower. Plenty of places to eat and drink just around the corner. A couple of useful stores like a drugstore and a massive wine outlet only moments. If you are staying on a weekend. Peter Street is also a hub for night life. There are many glitzy clubs right there on your doorstep. The music does not affect the rooms, but you will hear screaming girls and honking car horns. It also means that the hotel fills up with young people (Stag and hen parties) which might cause iritation. Service at the front desk was poor. There was only one person on duty and she seemed to be serving multiple people and handling the phones at the same time. So the service was not attentive, it was just functional. I had to ask questions to get any information from her. Hotel itself is standard Hilton Garden Inn. which for me means great rooms with great facilities. The breakfast area was good with a grill chef cooking to order as well as buffet for other things. Service in here was much better and attentive. I'm a bit torn on the rating this hotel as the location is both good and bad. Overall the service let it down. So i would try some of the other great hotels in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Great Price!”
Reviews.Author: Doug W
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Hilton Garden Inn was as comfortable as being at home. I recommend this hotel to anyone, be it for business, pleasure or a family vacation. The price was also amazing, especially for being right downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently great rooms, service and amenities!”
Reviews.Author: TVTD
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at The Hilton Garden Inn Downtown 3 different times. So obviously we have been pleased with our stays! We stayed at one other hotel on a different occasion and came right back! The rooms are always clean and all staff are extremely friendly and accommodating. The valet parking is quick and easy! It is close to the theatre district and many great restaurants. We will continue to visit this hotel when we are in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Met expectations”
Reviews.Author: mrtravcan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for one night last July. The hotel is very conveniently located to the nearby entertainment district, and 20 min walk to the island ferries, and is convenient to the Queen and King Streetcar lines if you wish to go further. Check-in was a bit slow since at that moment there was one person trying to do everything at the desk, but once we were served check-in went smoothly and the person at the desk was very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was included with the room and it is served on the second floor as a hot buffet breakfast style. If I remember correctly custom omelettes were being prepared as you wait. The food was of high quality and good variety. It was not just cereal and toast or muffins. The room was comfortable, clean and spacious and quiet. There was a small indoor pool on the second fllor which we used. It was adequate to do lengths, but not large by any means. We were able to store our luggage for several hours after checkout with no problems. Overall the experience was positive and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, staff and hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rose A
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed out stay. Great locaiton, and lovely room. We are repeat visitors and will continue to visit Hilton Gardens Downtown as our hotel of choice. Just around the corner from shows, the dome, and tons of great resaurants, too.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with awsome value”
Reviews.Author: Dana F
Reviews.Content: This is great hotel. The staff can't do enough for you and the hotel is very clean. They make the parking easy and it is so close to many attractions. We now use this as our hotel of choice when visiting Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but check in process was terrible”
Reviews.Author: rebeat0914
Reviews.Content: Met family in Toronto for Blue Jays games and had two rooms, each with two beds reserved for Saturday night. Arrived early before noon and didn't expect to be able to check in but was able to leave cars in hotel parking with our bags and were told to return after the game and we could check in. After 5 PM they still did not have two rooms available and suggested we go to dinner and then they'd be ready, Well, at 7:30, after dinner, they still did not have rooms ready (housekeeping still working on them!!!). The four kids, and the adults, were all tired of this. Front desk person said we could get into two adjoining rooms right away, but each room only had a king bed and a pull-out couch. We took them, but when went up, one of the rooms only had one bed and no couch!! Back down at the desk we were offered a portable cot "free of charge". Our original two rooms were finally clean but had already been given to someone else. Ended up with a nice room on the tenth floor with a good view of the CN Tower. Other than this terrible time getting checked in, this hotel was very good. Great location, especially for going to Rogers Centre, plenty of places to eat nearby, very good breakfast buffet, and has pool for the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but some room locations can be very noisy”
Reviews.Author: leonwalter
Reviews.Content: Nice staff, great location, wonderful breakfast, clean modern rooms, but if your room is on the south side of the building, the noise from the club next door will rock your world until about 2:30 AM. On the first night there, (a Friday night) our room was on the 16th floor and faced south. The music started at about 11:00 and was pounding loud until 2:30 am. After getting only 4 hours of sleep, I requested a new room. The next night I was in a North facing room and it was fine. All in all, a nice place, but I would only stay there if they could assure me that I would not be on that side of the building!

Reviews.Title: “Place to Check out”
Reviews.Author: Sunil-Globetroter
Reviews.Content: Located close to Downtown this place is on the city center. Had been here for 6 night. This place is very close to the Toronto Domino Bank office which is located in Royal Trust Tower 77 King Street West. The Toronto Central underground Station is just 5 to 7 mins away by walk, which connects to all sub-urbs. The Hotel is a bit expensive but the rooms are neat and very comfortable. If you plan to visit this hotel in late march early April, you need to book this hotel well in advance as most of the times the room are fully occupied. Even the china town is just 5 mins by walk and you can find many bus services from there to take you to Niagara falls. The Only drawback of this hotel is that usage of Business Center is a bit expensive and so is the Restauant in the hotel for the qulaity of food.

Reviews.Title: “the hotel is nice, close to the attractions”
Reviews.Author: rosellinarossa
Reviews.Content: the hotel is close to the main attractions (CN towers is 5-10 minutes walk, harbor 10 minutes) even if the street outside the hotel is not very nice, but you walk just one block and the streets are quite better, full of good restaurant and bars. I've read about noise, about a lot of guys trying to enter the hotel during the evening, but when i stayed in the hotel (during the week) i've found it quite. unfurtunatelly there is no view of CN tower from the hotel rooms, even if the cn tower is close. the standard is the garden inn standard, even if i stayed in the NYC garden inn and i found it better than toronto one (i guess the NYC hotel was new). in the room you could find everything you need: fridge, coffee maker, fre wifi, no safety box. the room is very clean. the hall is not very nice, but the rooms are: good decoration, very confy bed, very clean. the bathroom is very nice, good toilette stuff and double shower!!! in the lobby you have pc and printers for customers. i storngly reccomand this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, central, good free breakfast, decent sized rooms”
Reviews.Author: andrewv45
Reviews.Content: all good. good breakfast. clean big rooms. stay there often in Toronto

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: mubber
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Sept. 9th 2011 for two nighfts. Only a 5 minute walk to the Rogers Centre where we watched the Blue Jays. Good hotel with city view rooms. Room was very clean and the bed very comfotable. We had complmentery breakfast included which had a lare selection. This hotel is within walking distance to most major attractions. Only down falll was $40.00 a night parking.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: Fstrraveler
Reviews.Content: Good location, clean, good size room. Did not have a bath tub but I did not need one. Instead had very large shower room. Has all standard stuff includin coffee machine & fridge. Large flat screen & extremely comfortable bed, crisp sheets, great breakfast with made to order eggs and everything else. They have brown bags ready in case you are short in time and want to have breakfast on the go. Newspaper delivered daily.

Reviews.Title: “Love it !!”
Reviews.Author: Dounia E
Reviews.Content: Great Location , great price. staff was lovely except the lady who checked me in , wasnt a happy person , she didnt check me in until she make sure that i m a hilton employee , which i m not very happy about . it doesnt matter if im hilton employee or not , check me in first, make me feel welcome and then when i leave the front desk , call to check the level of my honesty , and if im not hilton employee , all you have to do is switch rate and give me call to let me know !!! Abbas was great GSA , very professional , and he was a lot of help . thank you abbas .

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: OmaXthree
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the last weekend in August 2011. We were visiting our children in Toronto and found the Garden Inn Downtown centrally located for every place we needed to be. My husband is confined to a wheelchair and we really appreciated the extra effort the valets took helping us remove the chair from the car, assemble it, get my husband into it and get us into the hotel. Any time we were leaving they reversed the process with nary an unpleasant word and always smiling. It was worth the cost of the parking just to have their assistance. The accessible room was just that - very accessible. And the bed was terrific! The hall was a bit noisy the first night because there were a lot of young adults staying there that night, but they finally quieted down. Breakfast was incredible and the server we had both days called us by name every time she addressed us. She happened to be outside as we were leaving on the last day and even called us by name then and wished us a safe trip home.

Reviews.Title: “All you need.”
Reviews.Author: Taralynne
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a conference at the Toronto convention center. Our convention was only a couple blocks away. Took about 5 minutes to walk. The hotel was clean and the rooms modern and good sized. The bathroom was lovely and clean as well. Surrounded by lots of restaurants and two less than two blocks from great shopping. There are lots of parking lots near by that look cheaper than the hotel valet system (one right across the road). Overall great hotel and all you need for downtown Toronto!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: baltscottie
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel to celebrate our 1 year wedding anniversary. Some of the pros: 1.) Rooms are clean and spacious with your own refrigerator and microwave. Since this hotel is fairly new, the bathrooms are very nice. 2.) The bed was the most comfortable bed that I've ever slept in. It is a sleep number bed so you can adjust the firmness. 3.) Staff was friendly and helpful. 4.) Indoor pool if you want to take a dip. 5.) Location location location. This hotel is in walking distance to most of the downtown attractions such as the CN Tower, Queen St, Front St, even Wayne Gretzky's restaurant is right down the street. 6.) Free high speed internet. I really don't have anything bad to say about this hotel, the price is a little steep per night but it is definitely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, spotless Hotel”
Reviews.Author: adamber
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel that hides into an average gray downtown building, standing on an average not important street. The room has everything you need, good and effective air-condition (important as we had 38Â°C outside), large flat screen 37" TV, fast cable Internet, excellent bathroom. The king bed was one of the best I ever had. Breakfast was served in the associated restaurant (but inside the hotel) and was very good (although the yellow cheese slices we had on the first day have disappeared for the next 3 days). Eggs are cooked to order and are really good. In short - nothing really to complain.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: C K
Reviews.Content: I recently travelled to Toronto on business and stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn downtown. As I travel regularly I am accustomed to hotels and the level of service. This hotel, by far, is the BEST hotel I have every stayed at. The service was exceptional and the rooms are very clean and comfortable. The staff, including the General Manager, ensured that I had everything I required. The facilities are also better than I have encountered in any hotel. They have an incredible pool and gym that are both kept impeccably clean. Be it for personal or business I highly recommend this property....it's location to all downtown amenities, sites coupled with the extrodinary customer service and high quality room make it a must!

Reviews.Title: “Handy for pretty much everything.”
Reviews.Author: gsalba
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights while checking out downtown Toronto and it was fine. We didn't use the hotel for much other than sleeping but we had two good nights sleep and wanted for nothing. Perfect location for getting about town and a short walk to the CN tower and Rogers Centre. Lot's of bars and restaurants nearby and plenty of local mini-markets for day to day necessities.

Reviews.Title: “If you get a room on the rear, move your room!”
Reviews.Author: Andland
Reviews.Content: The rooms and staff are fine. On the Thursday night of my stay a open air club cranked music till 3:00am. Thankfully it's deep bass, so ear plugs do little good. Just a heads up of you are staying there in the summer. I'd move rooms or hotels if you plan to sleep. Andy

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service!”
Reviews.Author: AlbertaMandy1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice during our vacation. The first night was during the huge Caribe fest and it was crazy outside! Lotsa partiers everywhere, but thanks to hotel staff & security you'd never know. Was close to watch the Jays, only a couple of blocks away. And to CN tower. And Hockey Hall of Fame. 1/2 block to Wayne Gretzky's! :-) Rooms VERY clean and were comfortable and roomy...sitting chairs and ottomans to put your feet up. But the best thing was the staff! Exceptional service! I was sick the last day and my husband and son ditched me to tour around. The front desk made sure I was ok and comfortable and even went out of their way to offer soup, neo citran etc. THANKYOU! Would definitely stay here again when we go to our next Jays game!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: merrijen
Reviews.Content: I stayed here just for 2 nights as I was in town for the theater. The hotel was less than 10 minutes walk from the entertainment distrct. The room was lovely. very clean and very nicely fitted out. Looked expensive. I had breakfast included in my rate and this was excellent. Everything cooked to order and a great slection from the cold buffet as well. Staff very friendly and efficient. Would definitely stay here again. Walking distance to the CN Tower. Short cab ride to shopping centre and lake side. It was a little bit noisy on Saturday night as there a couple of bars close by but nothing terrible and did not disturb my sleeping at all. Excellent all round!

Reviews.Title: “Spot on!”
Reviews.Author: Sooty123
Reviews.Content: Couldn't find any faults with this hotel. Great to stay in a new hotel, very clean, lovely furnishings and decor. Our room was a decent size with a street view from the fifth floor although it would have been great to be higher up for better views. Lots of thought has gone in to making guests happy, with a huge flat screen TV, very comfy bed, noon check-out, blackout curtains, fridge and fab bathroom with the huge shower/jet enclosure and nice toiletries! By far the best thing about our stay was the breakfast, we got a great deal as part of our booking through an external site (total $300 inc tax), if bought at the hotel it's around $15. The whole experience was great, from the service to the choice and quality of the food. You could make your own waffles with delicious toppings, huge choice of cereals and pastries, cooked items are made to order so fresh and yummy! The staff also tell you to take any left over muffins etc away with you when breakfast is closing at 10. Loved the area around this hotel, we had stayed around the Dundas area the previous week and this was much better. Nice walk down Blue Jays way to harbour area, left out of hotel to great shops on Queen Street. Right out of hotel and then left on to King St brings you to a great row of bars and restaurants - I recommend Verona italian! Well done Hilton! : )

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with GREAT breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: jmckay417
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn over the July-August long weekend and had a great time! The hotel is close enough to the big attractions to be convenient but still is not in an overly busy/loud part of town which was nice. The CN tower is about a 15-20 minute walk as is Union Station. The room was a good size with a nice flat screen tv and a really comfortable bed. In the shower there is a very nice rainfall shower head that feels great to get into after a long day walking around Toronto, especially in the heat! My only complaint about the room was the Wi-Fi...terrible signal from it and half the time (at least) I couldn't even get on the internet. The only thing we needed it for was looking up directions to places which we ended up just getting from hotel staff anyways and they were very friendly and helpful. The best part of the hotel by far though is the breakfast that came with our stay (The Great Escape package). A full cooked to order breakfast (including omlettes, eggs, waffles, home fries, bacon, sausage, toast, muffin, fruit, etc etc.) and they encourage you to take whatever you would like from the buffet in a paper bag when you leave! So you can pack a couple of apples or muffins for later in the day and save yourself some more money on food! All in all a great experience at the hotel...only thing they need to improve on is the wi-fi which really needs to be better than it was.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pehota
Reviews.Content: I was on a business trip and never expected to stay in such a nice hotel. Perfect location (CN tower and Rogers Centre just a short walk from the hotel). Friendly and helpful staff. Clean. Loved the in room coffee machine and microwave. I stayed at the hotel for 3 weeks and next time I'm coming to Toronto I'll ask my hosts to get me a room in Hilton Garden Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Downtown Location”
Reviews.Author: sally321
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 days with our family of 4 for a summer vacation. Overall we had a good experience. The hotel is fairly new and quite clean. The pool area was smallish but adequate. The room was a standard hotel layout with the addition of a small station with the microwave and fridge. The hotel is close to the CN tower and the Skydome, as well as Chinatown. Ontario Place was a short drive away. The property does have limited parking, although we were able to get a spot a few hours after checking in. Mind you, I couldn't bear to watch the valets take our new Toyota Siena van into the "car elevator". We had breakfast at the hotel one day and it was reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Close to Major Sights”
Reviews.Author: andrea162
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week, the hotel is nice, rooms are nicely appointed. Also it is conveniently located near a Shoppers which, with the in room microwave and fridge it makes it easy to have a quick snack in the room. Also very convenient was the free in-room wifi which I really appreciated as so many hotels still do not offer the in-room wifi option. With regards to the nightclub next door. I spoke with the front desk and they gave me a room as far away as possible, I did have to do a little convincing but it was no problem to be moved. There was an event on at the nightclub one night and I never heard anything. For some this may not be an issue, but also be aware, most rooms do not have bathtubs, just standup showers, so if you like to bath or have children who you need to bath, this is likely not the best choice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for young couples that don't mind the loud music at night.”
Reviews.Author: Oilers25
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at this hotel the last time we went to Toronto to see a jays ball game, located a few footsteps from the cn tower/rogers centre, very convenient location, very good price, clean room, friendly staff, but as other reviews say, and we were expecting it and didn't mind considering the price and location, this hotel is right next to a night club, so the music really boom booms until early morning, unless you are a light sleeper, I would recommend this hotel to you.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to theatre district, a little spare-feeling”
Reviews.Author: melted_snowball
Reviews.Content: We stayed here when we saw a play nearby, for which it was terrifically convenient. Price was good, too. There's good coffee nearby (I'm fairly sure that they didn't offer breakfast). The lobby is a little spare, and the furnishings are going down that Hilton Garden Inn direction of "your room is your office", which I appreciate when I travel for, well, business, and which appeals less for when I'm there because it's down the street from the theatre. And they did seem to have some issues with their parking being full; several people were being directed to other parking garages, etc. We'd taken transit into the centre of the city, so it wasn't an issue. The clientele seemed to include a lot of people whose night was just starting when we were getting back from the play (the hotel is also near a lot of nightclubs). Conveniently, we slept through their return, so I guess it's well noise-insulated.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service, Underhanded Billing, Complete Rip Off.”
Reviews.Author: michellebetts
Reviews.Content: I had been given a "customer appreciation" coupon package for the Hilton Garden Inn by a friend of mine - I initially thought the deal was great, as there were 3 coupons for 50% off a regular night's stay rate, and 1 coupon for a free weekend night stay (with a 39.00 housekeeping fee - only specified on the weekend coupon). I made a reservation for a Thursday evening, as a friend and I were attending the Raptors Draft event. Long story short, I was quoted 89.00 on my reservation, and presented with a 180.00 bill upon checkout. There was a mandatory 35.00 valet fee (which I was advised of) and then the 39.00 housekeeping fee (mentioned nowhere in my reservation confirmation, on the coupon (except for the weekend stay) or anywhere else. I tried to sort out my bill with the front desk clerk in the morning during checkout - she was incredibly rude and snide. Her equally rude colleage looked over at me at one point when i was advising of my quoted rate, and said "We never sell a room for less than 179.00, so you cant be right" then went back to the computer (FYI Hilton - a 2 min search on expedia and other hotel booking websites quickly proved him wrong, as there were rooms going for as low is 120.00). I emailed management and Hilton customer service and expressed my displeasure with the hidden fee. No one acknowledged that I was unsatisfied, or did anything about it. In such a competitive business, one would think the Hilton would at least make a half hearted attempt to give a crap - not so in this case. Not only will I never stay there again, but I cancelled the reservation I had made for the following Thursday (they made no attempt to disuade me) and found a nicer hotel, closer to downtown, online for 45.00 less than I had paid at the Garden Inn. Nice "customer appreciation" coupons, Hilton! In case no one had made you aware, people dont enjoy being fleeced, but they sure enjoy sharing a story about a terrible experience!

Reviews.Title: “We've stayed there twice, and will stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: RobertInBrooklyn
Reviews.Content: The hotel is convenient to all of Torontoâ€™s main attractions and close to the cityâ€™s exciting nightlife. The rooms are great. They are very nicely decorated and supper clean. We have stayed there twice now in the past two years and will definitely consider staying again on our next trip. We had no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Really good place to stay, near everything”
Reviews.Author: cchausse
Reviews.Content: First stay at Toronto with hubby. We wanted to be close to everything but didn't want to spend major bucks to, so we decided on this hotel; we didn't regret it! Walking distance to almost everything. Not near a subway, but no need, we walked everywhere. Nice clean room, big bed, big shower in the room. No frills, but clean clean clean. I'm a worrier about cleanliness, and clean it was. Free internet was nice too, and useful. The staff was nice to us, and our demands were answered quickly. The only thing i would not recommend is eating at the hotel; with as many restaurants nearby, go out. Going to go back there again when coming back to toronto!

Reviews.Title: “My favourite DT Toronto hotel”
Reviews.Author: OF-YVR
Reviews.Content: This has been my 5th stay or so at the Hilton Garden Inn in downtown Toronto. For the business traveler it is a very sensible choice. The location is good - a short walk to the financial district (where I do most of my business). By short I mean 10-15 minutes. It's a bit far from the Subway, more so than the Hilton/Sheraton on Richmond St. The rooms are roomy, clean, and comfortable, and the amenities are nice. Free Internet is always appreciated, as are Herman Miller chairs - I've spend hours working from my hotel room until late at night, and having a comfy chair is a huge plus. Prices are typically lower than the Hilton or Sheraton, and I actually prefer the rooms at the Garden Inn to both. Lots of restaurants to choose from - from tourist traps in the theatre district to cheap eateries on Spedina. Use Urbanspoon to find what you're looking for. It's always the first hotel I look up when I need to book a Toronto trip. Tip - there's a club right next to the hotel. I have never had any issues with noise, but a colleague of mine was staying and apparently had a room directly facing the club, resulting in lots of late night noise. Again - I never had any issues.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: postiegazLeeds
Reviews.Content: I have nothing bad to say about this hotel, helpful staff, clean tidy room, comfy beds, great location, it was a perfect place to stay. The only bad things that i can mention are that during my stay another guest decided to set the fire alarm of at 04:30, not a wake up call I want to repeat. Plus the spa had too much chlorine in and that my eye's were stinging. Would I use this hotel again? yes without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for downtown Toronto but not remarkable”
Reviews.Author: game_misconduct
Reviews.Content: In May, I attended a conference at the Hyatt around the corner. After reading the negative reviews for that hotel, I chose to stay at the Hilton Garden Inn because of the positive reviews on TA and also because I'm a Hilton Diamond member. The Hyatt proved incredibly disappointing as a conference venue and other attendees said the rooms there were disappointing also. The Hilton Garden Inn seemed a good option but I'd consider the Soho Metropolitan if I was looking for a more luxe experience. The rooms are mid sized... comfortable for one or two people but tight for more than that. The furniture and furnishings are newish, which befits the age of the hotel. The washroom was a bit cramped but there was decent water pressure for the shower. There is plenty of closet space and a large chest of drawers for clothing. The bed was comfortable, with plenty of pillows. The flat screen TV was set up prominently in the room. One bug was they didn't seem to ever get the newspapers on time to be delivered to the rooms in the morning --on only one morning did I wake up to find it outside my door. The free wi-fi strength wavered --it was strong in non peak hours but painfully slow in the morning and also before bedtime. Housekeeping was consistent but I tipped every day of my stay (and received thank you notes from the grateful staff). I bypassed the free breakfast so I can't rate on the quality of the offering. I ordered one meal from room service. Apparently the kitchen was quite busy that night due to heavy rain. Although it took me five minutes to get through, my food arrived within 15 minutes and was of decent quality for a burger and fries. The hotel is within walking distance of the everything in the entertainment district. There is a Shoppers Drug Mart, a LCBO liquor store and a natural food market within a two block radius --all of which are necessities for regular travelers, IMHO. There are also multiple restaurants and fast food locations close by. Other Toronto sites such as City Hall, Eaton Centre, etc are within a 10 minute walk. There are three street car lines within three blocks, although the subway is a further walk away. Service at the front desk is efficient, though not especially welcoming. On a whole, it was a satisfactory but not exceptional stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Rude Staff!”
Reviews.Author: bebeloz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on the weekend of June 11 for one night as I was celebrating my birthday and I had a coupon for this hotel. The location is amazing, central to just about everything. The rooms were nicely decorated and quite clean and I loved the added touch of the microwaves in each room. What ruined my stay here was the staff who get a big thumbs down from me! I stay at hotels quite often in toronto as well as overseas and never have I experienced such rude staff. I walked up to the front desk on Saturday around 4:00pm and there was no line at the desk so I thought " Great this should be quick and easy". Well it took a good 7 minutes before I was even acknowledged by a staff member at the desk. It felt as though I was invisible :( Finally when the front desk agent decided to pay attention she greeted me with a half smile and proceeded to go through the motions. I did not feel welcomed at all which has never been the case at any of the other downtown toronto hotels I have stayed at before. Well since it was my birthday we brushed that experience off and went on with our day. We came back to the hotel after a night out at around 2 am and had to enter through the side door. Since we were really tired we missed the sign that said we needed to slide out key to open the door and we proceeded to simply slide the door open without swiping. The door slid and on the otherside we were greeted by the rudest employee!! We apologized for missing the sign and he made us go back out and swipe our card and enter back in like we were some kind of criminals.! He then went on to demean us by saying " That is the first and last time this happens!" while raising his voice.Meaning 1st and last time we forget to swipe our key. I was too in shock to ask for his manager as his behaviour was out of bounds! We missed the sign by accident, give me a break! How could he be so rude. I walked away quite stunned and upset. The actual hotel establishment is quite nice however the staff totally ruined m yexperience. If you stay here and encounter rude staff do not be afraid to ask for the manager! I have once more coupon for this hotel and I am thinking about selling it as I prefer to stay at more hospitable hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and pleasant hotel, convenient in downtown location”
Reviews.Author: 2Stuges
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 5 days attending a conference and would stay here again. Pros: convenient central lOcation, very comfortable bed, free wifi are all great aspects for business or leisure traveler to have. There was also a small fridge and microwave in the room. Cons: Saturday night was very noisy-- club on street just below the hotel had noise that was heard even on my upper floor room with windows closed. Other non-weekend nights were better. I would stay again if coming to Toronto

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: simoo69
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn for 3 nights in June. Describe the service you experienced - Front desk staff very polite and friendly. Check in was very quick and easy. Top tip!!! If you use the restaurant (we did for breakfast) don't pay with cash!!! Put it on the room account. It took nearly half hour to get change! They don't keep change in the restaurant!!! Bizarre!
