Also, the staff for some reason couldn't seem to do the sums right! Took three attempts to get my change right and even then they got it wrong! The staff were very friendly and service was great just lacked a calculator! Tell us how you liked the room - Had a 2 queen bed room - very spacious and beds were extremely comfortable. Free wi-fi! Also, think I may have been lucky with a view from the room of the CN Tower! Talk about the location & amenities - Location is very central with all major attractions close by - walked everywhere. From the airport got a car that seated 5 people and luggage and cost $65 which we didn't think was too bad - took about 25 minutes. The hotel had a indoor pool and gym facilities but didn't use them. Food for breakfast was very good with lots to choose from. Say what you liked best & least - The best part in my opinion was the view of the CN Tower, but not every room will have that - other than that it would have to be the room size and beds. The palaver with the change in the restaurant was the only niggle and although it was a little comical, I can imagine it would become very irritating if it happened more than once.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay!”
Reviews.Author: momartin8
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to visit Toronto for a business trip. I spent 3 nights at the Hilton Garden Inn. Overall, I had a very pleasant stay. The front desk staff was friendly, and they checked us in quickly. The room was very clean and spacious. I had breakfast every morning in the Marquis Room. The cooked to order omelets were great! I also had drinks one evening there. The martinis are a bit pricey. However, the bartender who was there at the time (unfortunately, I don't remember her name) was excellent. She was so friendly and outgoing and fun to talk to! The hotel is within walking distance to numerous restaurants, coffee shops, a drug store, and wine & liquor store. I would definitely recommend this hotel for business or pleasure travel.

Reviews.Title: “Just one little glich”
Reviews.Author: crossword fan
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in early June with spouse. Room was very comfortable, good location for sightseeing in Toronto, breakfasts cooked to order, and all went well until the third night when the nightclub next door went into action. We were on the fourteenth floor and though we couldn't hear the music (which lasted until around 4 A.M.) the beat of the base permeated through the walls and just couldn't be stopped. And I was wearing earplugs. So, I can recommend the hotel, but please stay on the side where, hopefully, the base beat can't get you.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, large clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: cs_5
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel for business, well located, espc for the convention centre. Free wifi throughout. Modern, large, clean rooms. Downsides, my room was quite dark and one night the club next door was playing very loud music which kept me awake. Would stay here again though.

Reviews.Title: “This is the second time we have stayed here and we love it!”
Reviews.Author: Marlene28
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel.It is clean and beautiful.The staff treat you like friends.It is so centrally located that you can access downtown Toronto at its best.You are in walking distance to everything.We will be staying here again for sure. The rooms are beautiful and spacious. We would highly recommend it to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient & Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: TranspaciFlyer
Reviews.Content: The hotel delivers on everything it promises. I used the room for sleeping and to prepare for some meetings. Quiet, comfortable and utilitarian. I used to stay at the full service Hilton on Rishmond, but I prefer the low key ambience of this Hilton brand. The bed and the linens were excellent. I kno they have some sort of sleep selection gizmo on the bed, but I fell in love with the mattress all the same. I wasn't staying there for a vacation, although it makes a nice place to do that if you are visiting Toronto, but was there for a good night's sleep for business. I got that rest I needed and just for that, the hotel gets my repeat business. The dining option was reasonable and the food (dinner & breakfast) was ok. Actually, dinner was of better quality than I was expecting since this wasn't a full service Hilton. yet the restaurant had the same high quality as the big box Hilton. The prices were comparative to the restaurants in the neighborhood with the difference that service was much better and of course there was the convenience. There was even a decent wine selction and a waiter that offered reliable advice. Someone invested in training the staff and it showed. The hotel also had professional trained desk personnel. I was checking in and waiting while one of the people at the desk was providing directions to a guest. Sometimes desk people can have an attitude, but not this woman. A sincere smile and a really good attitude. That's how a hotel gets repeat business and builds brand loyalty. I am usually tough in my reviews, but honestly, I can't find one fault with this place. I got what I paid for and a bit more at that. Maybe some hotels have a lower rate, but if you are looking for consistency, and quality at a competitive room rate in the downtown core, you really cannot go wrong with this place.

Reviews.Title: “Flawless Stay at a Reasonable Price”
Reviews.Author: Psychologyguy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn Toronto Downtown for 3 nights in June, and we found the experience great. Based on the TripAdvisor reviews that I read saying that the Peter Street side of the hotel can get noisy due to a nightclub, when I checked in I asked if it were possible to have a "quiet room not over the nightclub." We were given a 15th floor room not on the Peter Street side, and indeed it was QUIET. (I have very sensitive hearing, I typically have to sleep with ear plugs, and there was no noise [with the exception of my hearing a car blow its horn once during our stay.]) The room was modern, large, with a nice bathroom. I noticed that there were complimentary cookies at the front desk -- a nice touch (I didn't try them). My ONLY surprise was that the bathroom had a shower (the size of a bathtub) rather than a bathtub. I don't know whether all the rooms have showers or just some. It really didn't bother me, because I prefer showers to baths. I was just surprised. (Perhaps I didn't read the hotel's description well enough -- my fault?) We tended to leave the Do Not Disturb sign on the door for a good part of the day, and yet every time we returned to the room (after having taken the sign down), the room was made up. Front staff was polite, courtesy, helpful, and on the ball. My wife and I particularly found this hotel to be very centrally located in the Entertainment section of Toronto. Every time we come to Toronto, we take in an evening of comedy at Second City, and we were surprised that the hotel is about 2 blocks from there -- Peter Street becomes Blue Jay Lane, the street address for Second City. Overall, a wonderful experience, and we DEFINITELY will be returning. Oops!: Forgot to say that we found the price of the room very reasonable. And, the bed was VERY comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good!”
Reviews.Author: Hammythehamster
Reviews.Content: Three of us stayed for two nights on a hectic trip, arriving on an overnight flight from the States. We needed a early check in and a late check-out - which we got with a smile - nothing was too much trouble for the staff of this hotel. Hilton gives the impression of being a bit corporate and impersonal, but this hotel is the opposite - small in scale and really, really friendly (or perhaps this is just Toronto). The rooms are well-equipped and comfortable. The hotel is in a good location, central and easy to walk from - the Art Gallery of Ontario is well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good downtown choice”
Reviews.Author: etb2102
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in spring and had a good time despite the bad weather. The hotel is very conveniently located in downtown Toronto and overall the stay was very satisfactory for the price. I used the fitness center and pool which were both small but well maintained. Pros: room very clean and well-lit; staff extremely helpful; extra comfortable beds (probably one of the best hotel beds I've slept in) Cons: room internet was very slow except for very basic email checks; breakfast room was understaffed so that two frantic staff-members were running around looking very flustered and struggling to deal with all the guests

Reviews.Title: “Hilton comfort and reliable service”
Reviews.Author: GMCann
Reviews.Content: I often stay at Hilton properties and the Toronto Hilton Garden Inn offers a great, and expected, level of service and comfort. The rooms are equal to anything Hilton offers, the fitness facility is first rate and the restaurant staff are friendly and attentive - to the right degree. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Friendly, Convenient.”
Reviews.Author: Stephnsuch
Reviews.Content: Our room was clean, comfortable and attractive. The bed and pillows were very comfortable as well. The bathroom was spacious and very clean. The staff in the hotel were very friendly, polite and helpful. Any questions we had were answered immediately. Even though it was a very busy weekend (UFC 129) the hotel was quiet and our rest was not disturbed by any of the other guests. The hotel was very convenient for shopping and sight seeing. We were able to walk nearly everywhere we wanted to go. There are a fair number of homeless people in the area...but it is downtown Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: RR_USA
Reviews.Content: Pros: Friendly staff, good location, room (evolution room) in excellent condition. Cons: none. Verdict: Very good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time, all our needs were met”
Reviews.Author: Wingerbinger
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn in downtown Toronto. The hotel was beautiful. Everything was to our standards, and all of our needs were met. The service was excellent, we were offered a deal on breakfast at check in. The breakfast was much better than I expected. For a price of $10 we had a choice of hot and cold items, both ready made, and made to order. The room was clean and comfortable with modern decor. The front desk staff and the parking valet were very friendly, and helpful. The hotel location is ideal for a visitor to the city, within easy walking distance of the entertainment district, the business district, and great shopping and dining.

Reviews.Title: “What a sweet deal”
Reviews.Author: 504yesindeeed
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a sort of dual job interview/anniversary vacation. After shopping for prices online for a couple of hours, this is what we came up with. The room was immaculate, the front desk was extremely helpful (even comped us some free cough drops when my wife came down with a sore throat), and the fitness room/swimming pool was a spotless and very updated. It was actually kind of cold in Toronto during our trip and the hotel was incredibly well insulated and the thermostat was ridiculously responsive. We didn't try the restaurant or the bar, so I can't comment on that. Overall, I highly recommend it for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Our favourite downtown Toronto hotel”
Reviews.Author: sarah11918
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel extensively over the past 2 - 3 years (including an entire summer off and on) and we have simply never had a bad stay. We don't even look around anymore. If we know we're going to stay downtown, this is where we book. Pros: -The rooms are in the best condition you could want. The hotel is only a few years old, and it's one of the newest-feeling and cleanest hotels around. The house keeeping staff is excellent, and friendly if you meet them in the halls. The rooms are also pretty spacious for big city hotel rooms. The bathrooms are a very good size. If you treat yourself to a jacuzzi room (tub beside the bed), you'll have all the room two people could possibly want. As Hilton Diamond VIP members (which we were the last couple of years), we were entitled to upgrades to the jacuzzi room if one was available. I think we had pretty much a 100% success rate with upgrades over the space of 2 years. So when you're checking in, it doesn't hurt to ask. ;) - The beds are the sleep number beds, which many people love. I personally don't think they're as spectacular as the hype, but there's no doubt that these hotel beds are absolutely comfortable, and the bedding is plush with lots of pillows. -The location is excellent for nightlife, shopping, dining, and only minutes walk to the Rogers centre for Jays games or other events. There's also an excellent diner at the corner with great diner-style breakfasts and breakfast burritos. Going to the other corner, there's a great new higher end burger place that's just opened. If you don't mind walking 10 min. or so, you're also not far away from Dark Horse espresso bar for a great fair trade coffee or cappuccino. Just a couple minutes to King St. and you're in the theatre district with ample choice of medium and high end restaurants. You're surrounded by so much shopping (Shoppers Drug Mart, Chapters, liquor store, Queen St. West, Eaton Centre a bit of a walk away) that I couldn't possibly list everything. The less than perfect (because so much of this hotel is quite perfect): - I'm not sure I have ever been able to print successfully from the business centre! We haven't tried in a long time, but when we stayed a couple of summers ago for most of the summer, you had to print from your laptop to the web printing service that gives you a choice of which location worldwide where you want your document to print. Then you create a PIN number, and you're supposed to be able to go down the printer and enter the PIN number to retrieve your document. This isn't the first hotel I've had trouble with that particular system. The business centre is quite small, located off the lobby, and since we always bring our own laptops, printing is the only use we would ever have for it. - The lobby is pretty small, and usually quite crowded. Since the hotel is so close to Rogers Centre, the lobby is also a pretty common gathering place for groups of people staying together. It can be difficult to tell who is in line to speak to the front desk vs. who's milling about. Once you get 2 - 3 people in line for the front desk, it can take a bit of maneuvering even just to pass by. - We don't drive, so it doesn't affect us, but we do hear other guests in the lobby (since it's always so crowded) complaining about the fees for parking. Unfortunately, it's downtown Toronto and there simply aren't many options available. Guests used to cities like New York probably don't think twice about it, but other Canadians from out of town will likely notice. - Because we are constantly on the road, we usually prefer hotels with kitchenettes. Going to a hotel isn't usually a "treat" for us since we're so often traveling and we get sick of having to spend the time and money to go out for every meal. Fortunately, there is so much good food very close by, including quick and take out food if you don't feel like spending a lot of time out. The rooms do have microwaves and bar fridges so we can bring back leftovers or pick up a few grocery items at the large Shoppers Drug Mart on the corner. In some other places we stay, the lack of a kitchenette suite would be a drag. But in this location it worked out, even when we stayed for weeks at a time. - The rates aren't cheap enough to make you feel like you're getting a discount, but the service and rooms are just so consistently excellent, in a location that can't be beat, that we feel it's worth booking specifically rather than using Hotwire to get the best deal we can. At least we know what we're getting, and we are getting value for our money, even if we're spending more than we usually have to for a downtown hotel room through a discount service. When we had our top tier Hilton status, we were always upgraded to a jacuzzi room anyway, so for us it was completely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, excellent location, part of a great trip!”
Reviews.Author: elfy10
Reviews.Content: I went to Toronto to see a show, so this hotel, situated right in the Entertainment district, was very conveniently located. It is about a 10-minute walk away from the arrival point of Billy Bishop Airport's shuttle. During the summer, you can't beat a $0 "travel fee" from the airport to your hotel. It is also a few steps from the tram and 5 minutes' walk from the subway. I had loads of things to see during this trip, and transport was never a problem. For the hotel itself, my room was spacious (king room), quiet (10th floor with a view on CN Tower) and equipped with free internet and fridge, two things I appreciate to keep costs low (I'm a new self-caterer). Breakfast is expensive though, so I recommend grabbing it someone else. The 24-h business center with printer and copier came in handy for booking CN Tower tickets and boarding passes. Staff was pleasant, though they did seem a little disorganized (it took a long time to get their attention). Getting a taxi was never a problem though, there are always some near the front entrance. With no major problems and only 1 or 2 very minor irritants, I would definitely go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Clean and Fresh”
Reviews.Author: altyaces
Reviews.Content: Arrived early 10.15 and asked if I could leave my bags and check in later, the girl on the desk let me check in straight away, a real bonus when sometimes they make you wait until 3pm. The room was great, the only issues we had was with Valet parking and having a room at the front of the hotel. The Saturday night rave at the local night spot was fairly noisy and interrupted our sleep. The 20 minute wait the following morning for the car wasn't good either especially as I could have parked across the street for $15 dollars rather than the $36 the hotel charge, Overall recommended

Reviews.Title: “the best for Toronto nightlife”
Reviews.Author: jot23
Reviews.Content: My friends and I always book the Hilton when we have a big night out downtown for its convenience and great rooms. It's a one to ten minute walk from all the clubs in that area, in fact it's right NEXT to one. Despite this (and some of the other reviews), I found that the hotel is quiet and I was never disturbed by what is going outside. We've stayed here at least 5 times, the last being NYE. That was a bit of a pain, but understandable, because it was getting extremely rowdy and it was clear people were bringing in about 10 people into one room. This night was a bit of a mess; we would walk out to the hallway and smell weed, hear loud music blasting, etc. Every other time we had no problems, however there are only 2 elevators and they DO take a while, especially that night. Excellent rooms. We usually get the 2 queen beds, very spacious, comfortable, clean. Washroom is big too, lots of counter space (which is handy when you have 4 girls doing their hair and makeup). A HUGE plus is that there's a microwave and mini-fridge in every room! Staff is also very friendly and accommodating. If you want to check in early (it's usually 3pm), call in advance and many times they have some rooms that are ready, and they'll let you in with no extra charge. This has happened for us several times. If we call for extra towels/sheets/cups, it's all sent up very quickly by housekeeping staff. Love this hotel, great location ... if you're a group of young people looking for nightlife and shopping (Queen West is right there with a bunch of stores, Chinatown and Kensington is walking distance), definitely give this hotel a shot!

Reviews.Title: “look elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: primitivepete
Reviews.Content: It's a shame this nice hotel is run by total incompetence. No housekeeping showed up the first day, had to call the front desk for clean towels. Asked for coffee that night, it never arrived. Went down the next morning still no coffee, front desk didn't have any. Had to wait till 10 am for housekeeping to come on shift. Front desk personel have the "not my job" attitude. For this they want $200 day? tip: everybody and there dog is waiting to checkout at 12 so the vallet parking attendants are overwhelmed., 55 minutes to get your car back, park across the street for 1/2 price if you must stay here...

Reviews.Title: “Too noisy!”
Reviews.Author: UncleMatty
Reviews.Content: The rooms in this hotel are really nice and the front desk staff were very friendly when we checked in. However, it's right next to a really noisy nightclub. So, on Saturday nights at least, you're not going to get a lot of sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: tsharner
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a great stay at a comfortable, clean and convenient downtown Toronto hotel and we found it here. The rooms were very clean and comfortable and the location was very convenient to a lot of major attractions downtown. We parked our car and never looked back because everything was within walking distance. A great place for a family of four (2 children under 10).

Reviews.Title: “Who knew you could get a room like this for a price like this in the Entertainment District?”
Reviews.Author: PegLeg-and-SherBear
Reviews.Content: Was in Toronto for a friends wedding and they had this hotel listed as a mid-priced option for their guests. We found it very easily and happily gave the car over to the valet as soon as we got there. You can self-park but being right downtown I figured it wasn't worth the hassle to save a few bucks. We were checked in right away by a very cheerful clerk who outlined all the hotel amenities and their operating hours. She even called us by name. The room was such a pleasant surprise we had booked a standard room and as far as I know that's what we got but we had a beautiful view of the CN tower. Also the room had a two person whirlpool bath from which you could watch either the TV or the fireplace. The hotel is right beside a nightclub. I was a bit concerned about what this would mean as we were staying over on a Saturday night. Happily to get in the hotel at night you need to use your keycard and they ask you to confirm your room number and name at the front desk prior to accessing the elevator. The bed was so comfortable that we fell right to sleep and never noticed any noise from the club. If you've got to be downtown Toronto I'd recommend this property for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: JamesII
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Garden Inn is a good choice for either business or leisure in Toronto. This hotel is a convenient walk to Rogers Centre, China Town, and some of the theaters. It is convenient to a nearby Shopper's Drug Mart (to pick up some in room snacks) and a large LCBO with a rather big Vintages section for some excellent wine for the room. There is an excellent restaurant in the hotel on the second floor Also on the second floor is a small pool and a very good gym. The buffet breakfast is really quite good and worth the price if you are hungry. Being in the heart of the entertainment district may be a plus for some but for me it means that you can't leave your window open at night for fresh air because of all the noise from the late night revellers. The rooms are new and well appointed. You can get a whirlpool room with a fireplace if you are so inclined and the price is pretty much the same as a room without. The rooms have a small fridge, a microwave oven and a large flat screen television. This place is quite reasonably priced and close to some of this great city's main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location but needs soundproof windows”
Reviews.Author: JudyG70
Reviews.Content: BAD: Make sure you request a room that is not above the nightclub downstairs on Peter St. We were on the 17th floor & we could still hear all the music, even with our windows shut. Thought we were safe so high up, but it was still noisy. Can't imagine if you're on the lower floors!! GOOD: Location is awesome!!! You can pretty much walk everywhere in downtown. We found the best street to walk - Queen Street & it's just a few short blocks from the hotel. Tons of little restaurants, small shops (not big retail stores), kind of an artsy feel. Also, tons of bars everywhere!!! The hotel's restaurants was actually good too!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and facilities but customer service leaves something to be desired”
Reviews.Author: careofme
Reviews.Content: I stayed for five nights at the HGI Toronto Downtown for a business trip. I will try to keep this review as concise as possible but I have a lot to say! The location was very centrally located in the downtown Toronto area. Actually, the hotel is located in the "Entertainment District" which, for a business-minded hotel, might not make the best sense. Unfortunately, I arrived around 11pm on a Saturday night and the street outside the entrance to the hotel was crowded with "club-goers", and crowds which needed some more control/restraint. The transportation from the airport (Airport Express) refused to drive down the street the hotel is located on due to how busy and congested it was requiring me to walk two blocks in a suit, with my luggage through a busy crowd! Upon my final arrival, I found the hotel lobby door was locked and took a few minutes of struggling in order to gain entrance. As I had requested weeks in advance, the "quiet room" was not available and I was told that I could switch if it was too loud. The room given was facing a club's alley where there were people outside all night playing cards and drinking/smoking making for a terrible first night of rest after a long day of traveling. I was told that although my request for room location and king bed was not granted, the hotel was "full" and there was nothing they could do. As a upper level HHonors member, I found this unacceptable, yet, I continued to endure and eventually the clubs closed and the weekend passed making for a more quiet week of sleep. Overall the building itself was immaculate, very clean and modern. The cleaning staff were very good and eager to please. A microwave and fridge in the room catered to my "doggy bags." The pool area and jacuzzi were well maintained and tended to every shift. The business center had two newer computers with printing and fax services available. Free high speed wired and wireless internet was great. The lobby was small but inviting. Although, they should have had coffee/tea and/or water available 24 hours daily instead of sporadically as they did during my stay. The cookies, which I was not offered upon check-in were nice but somewhat stale tasting. One issue which arose every morning was in retrieving a taxi cab. You would think that there would be a taxi cab stand or quick access to a taxi cab in the morning at this hotel, unfortunately, this was not the case and upon more than two occasions was delayed in my departure even after calling 15 minutes in advance in order to have a taxi waiting for departure. Since this was my first visit to Toronto I had desired some information regarding places to visit and see. Although helpful, they were not that knowledgeable regarding these questions and I found it to be disheartening. There was major disparity in quality of service between the day and night shift workers. Some extra training in customer service skills is warranted for the night shift workers as they were not that attentive nor friendly to my questions or requests. Overall my stay at the HGI Toronto Downtown was satisfactory. I do not think that the price of the stay $200 CAD/night was justified given the above, however, perhaps this is the normal expectation in a downtown Toronto Hotel. My suggestion for the hotel management is that they work on customer service and satisfaction as this was a frequent theme that seemed to be present throughout my stay. I was never asked if there was anything they could do for me....something that I have come to expect at Hilton Brand hotels which has kept me frequently returning for many many stays. I would likely not stay at this hotel again when visiting Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: hrktdn
Reviews.Content: I am just disappointed with this hotel service quality as a Gold HHonor member. Since my room has only shower, I've been asking a room with a bathtub many times, but they don't my request seriously. They just say "come tomorrow" and next day I go to the front desk, "we don't have one." They didn't even take a note of my request. I am so not going to stay with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in central Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Base_camp_Helsinki
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located in the center of Toronto within easy walking distance from all major attractions and shopping. The rooms are clean and modern and very quiet for a downtown hotel. I can honestly say I have never slept better in a hotel bed. Bathrooms are clean, and spacious. The fitness room and the pool were very small, which did not matter much as we appeared to be the only guests using them. Both were clean and had working equipment. Valet parking was very expensive considering that even during the Toronto International Film Festival there was plenty of parking available close to the hotel for almost 1/10 of the cost charged by the hotel. High speed internet was included in the fee and worked perfectly throughout our stay. Breakfast was fairly expensive and although choices were limited I believe there was something available for everyone. Staff was knowledgeable and helpful without being intrusive. We were accidentally charged an extra night for valet parking, but staff handled the mistake professionally without hassle which made us appreciate the service even more. We will definately stay here in the future if we have the opportunity to visit Toronto again.

Reviews.Title: “Best location downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: kymgru
Reviews.Content: The location was wonderful, a stones throw from King Street which is the entertainment district area. Its my new favorite place to stay, you can walk to the Eatons center quite fast and of course Queen St is even closer. Hotel is brand new, with valet parking, service is exeptional with extra personal touches of the staff remembering you from check in. Beds were adjustable to firmness and the chairs in the rooms are awsome! Housekeeping changed towels when not needed, and so on and so forth!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice!”
Reviews.Author: PauloCesar_S
Reviews.Content: I was with my wife in Toronto, September 2010. The Hotel location is excellent, near the CN Tower and many other attractions. The staff is very polite and attentive. On the day of checkout, the front desk got a limo for the price of a common taxi to take us to the airport. The Hotel is very clean, has free WiFi, is well decorated and very comfortable. The bathroom is large, the shower is great, everything you might expect from a hotel of this category.There are some clubs close, but had no problems with noise, even at the reception. Hurry, this hotel is what you need in Toronto!

Reviews.Title: “Check your invoice”
Reviews.Author: lmnk0025
Reviews.Content: I booked online with travelocity, which was prepaid for a room with a king size bed, when i arrived they asked for a credit card for a deposit. the next morning i recieved my check-out saying the balance of $169.91 had been settled to my card. since i had already been charged $200 by travelocity i asked the girl at the front desk if they ahd made an error. she assured me they had not and that the charge would not appear on my card. 3 days later the charge appeared on my card. still trying to get it settled.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jamesd95
Reviews.Content: Location was fantastic. Walking distance to CN Tower, Rogers Center and other major attractions. Two blocks from King Street West where the main theaters and good restaurants are located. 5-6 blocks from the main subway on Yonge St. 20 minute walk to the waterfront. Two blocks from Queen St. West which has many unique botique shops. There is nothing special about Peter St. itself where the hotel is located, but I felt safe even at night. Room was fine. There is only a small lobby, so if you are looking for a grand hotel, this is not it. Desk service was excellent. "Free" breakfast was super. Not just rolls and coffee but a complete buffet with hot breakfast requests. Parking rates are high but that is true anywhere in the downtown area. Would definitely stay there again when visiting Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel with good service”
Reviews.Author: sydcarnie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a tour group. The hotel seems to be quite new and very clean and comfortable. There was a business centre, gym and pool, all of which were high quality. The beds were very comfortable and the bathrooms a very good size. There was also a very much needed laundry! The service was exceptional and went beyond the standard service. The hotel was conveniently located close to most sights in the city. Would definately recommend to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel,ideal location,but beware noisy club next door!”
Reviews.Author: Wigbury
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Garden Inn is in a great location within walking distance of C.N.Tower and Rogers Stadium and next to a wide selection of restaurants,bars,shops etc There are fresh apples to help yourself each morning and cookies at night,also complimentary drinks on some days ?The rooms are spacious and clean BUT if you are stayingThursday through until Sunday there is a club with a patio next door and the noise is terrific until around three in the morning so if your not out yourself you will not sleep.We only had this experience on the Sat night the rest of our stay was perfect through until the following Wednesday.Fridge,microwave abd coffe maker in room really useful.Go to the italian quarter for some really great little restaurants and bars.Toronto is a terrific city ENJOY!!

Reviews.Title: “smart clean hotel in great location - better than Marriot Residence Inn”
Reviews.Author: katyS_9
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for our last night at end of two weeks in Canada, having stayed at the Marriot Residence Inn in the Entertainment district for the first 3 nights of our holiday, Whilst we got a good value deal there for a one bedroom suite, I have to say I preferred the Hilton. Clean, shiny new hotel with spacious welcoming lobby and attractive decor. Our room had two double beds with all new fitments to a high quality. Linen crisp and clean, beds comfy, v quiet with view over CN Tower. Pool and hot tub clean, though bizarrly no changing room. The most strikingly superior feature compared to The Residence Inn was the breakfast which was AMAZING at the Hilton! My kids loved making their own waffles, whilst a chef prepared cooked breakfast/omelettes/pancakes to order. Fresh fruit and fruit juices, breads and pastries, and coffee brought to the table rather than stewed out of a communal urn. Great location for CN Tower/Blue Jays with plenty of local bars and restaurants, and easy access to tramcars. Night club outside was busy, but we heard nothing from our room. In summary, comfortable clean moderm hotel in great location - I would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “New first choice downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: azzaia
Reviews.Content: I slept in many hotels downtown Toronto, and I can say this new Hilton hotel is the best one. Convenient location, quiet and large room (mine was very quiet, while some rooms are not because of the proximity of night clubs), wonderful breakfast, free Internet. Nothing to complain about (but for the freezing cold in the main hall...)

Reviews.Title: “Best Hilton Garden Inn I've seen or stayed at”
Reviews.Author: bunbop
Reviews.Content: Location was fantastic. Walking distance to CN Tower and other major attractions. Club district for clubbers out there. Shopping district for shoppers out there. Close to subway line and easy subway transportation. Loved our room. Whirlpool tub next to the bed with a fireplace. Breakfast was super. Parking rates are high as you will find in all major cities around the world. Will definitely stay there again when visiting Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, modern and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tapetenwechsler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in Entertainment District with lots of bars, restaurants and clubs nearby. However, unlike one of the other reviewers, we had no trouble with high loise level on the weekend - the reason might be that our room faced the back of the hotel - in front of the hotel there is a night club. The bedroom as well as the bathroom were very clean, of a good size and equipped with modern amenities. The very comfortable bed was a highlight. We also used the indoor pool (pool length 10 m) which is on the same floor as the breakfast room - the pool area is clean but has a very basic feel (e.g. there are no changing rooms, which is a bit impractical since there are no bathrobes in the rooms). The reception staff was very friendly and efficient. Free use of internet is available in a separated room (small business centre) in the lobby, where you can also have coffee or water.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast was outstanding...”
Reviews.Author: masuret_baloun
Reviews.Content: We were so pleased with this hotel that we stayed an extra night! We liked so many thinga about this Hilton, but probably the best is LOCATION. We were able to walk to everything in Toronto. That said, the rooms were wery nice and a good size for a city hotel. Having the refridgerator and microwave is essential for us when traveling with our kids - so that was a plus. The hotel seemed to have a balance of families, business, foreign tour bus groups and couple travelers. It was also VERY quiet. The beds are firm but the pillows are soft (perfect combo for me). The valet parking service guys are really nice and rest assured your car will be safe. OKAY, LASTLY - - BREAKFAST IS AWESOME. Pool/Hot Tub isn't much to write home about.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: supernovea
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! Excellent location! We could see the CN tower from our room. Bathroom very clean. However the carpet in the room had 2 stains. Since we never walk bare feet on the carpet and the rest was clean, I assumed it had been cleaned but it didn't come off. We were allowed to check in a couple of hours earlier which helped us a lot (to drop off the luggage). Wireless internet was complimentary in the room which is great. There was a little noise in the adjacent rooms, walls are paper-thin as in most hotels. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, BUT WARNING, not for families on weekends”
Reviews.Author: Lynwin63
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right next door and across from 2 nightclubs. From 11:00 to 3:00 a.m. it is full of young people outside the hotel, in the lobby, making it difficult to get to your room. Young people obviously choose this hotel to stay at so we had to contend with a LOT of drunkeness in the hallways waking us up on more than one occasion. At closing time, there was a fight outside our hotel in the street and a near riot ensued where police needed to be called (all of which kept us up for another 45 mins. DO NOT PARK across the street (a lot of action occurs there at night) pay the hefty $35 valet, which parks in the basesment. The hotel itself is great but I wouldn't stay there on Thur, Fri or Sat because of this, which is too bad, because the location to the theatre district is great and the breakfast was the best any hotel has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: cvillevatourist
Reviews.Content: The staff of this hotel were welcoming, helpful and very friendly. The hotel was sleek and clean. Location was perfect for walking around the city. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: PGilchrist
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night while in Toronto for the Manchester United vs. Celtic match. Very nice hotel, clean, and helpful staff. Great location and a short walk to much of Toronto's sights. I did note that on one side of the hotel you can hear a slight "thump thump thump" from the night club next door. Not enough to bother me, but if your a light sleeper may want to stay on the other side of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room - loved the whirlpool bath”
Reviews.Author: savvytravelfan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in June (just before the G20 summit so was full of police officers - never felt safer!). A fairly small hotel for Toronto but modern (it is a pretty new property) and very, very clean. The staff on the front desk were very polite and helpful. We had one of the King rooms with a whirlpool. It had a lovely spacious bathroom and a really comfortable bed. The whirpool was great - it is located in the bedroom rather than the bathroom and was big enough for two! There was also a fire in the room which I imagine would be cozy on winter nights. We really enjoyed our stay here, it is in good location in the Entertainment district, and though we didn't try the restauant or breakfast it looked very good! Would definitely chose this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “New, Clean, Comfortable - No Surprises”
Reviews.Author: MTLSteve
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights in July while the Red Sox were in town (Rogers Centre). Hotel is new, everything was in good working order. Staff was friendly, easy check-in. Rooms were large for a downtown hotel, nicely appointed. We had 2 Queen beds as well as an arm chair, desk, and flat-panel television. Bathroom was a good size, with typical HGI finishings and amenities. The mini-fridge and microwave were very handy. We were on the 17th floor and had a nice view of some of the taller buidings as well as the CN Tower. 4 blocks to the Rogers Centre, 3 blocks from Queen St West. Can't complain. The surrounding areas were a little loud at night as it's in the middle of a bar district - however it didn't really bother us in the room. The hotel was sold out for both nights we were there and we didn't hear any neighbours, ever. Pool is very small, and every time we stopped by there it was quite busy. Didn't end up using it. Didn't try the restaurant. Lobby was a little small and at times quite crowded, but once you pass through that it was a non-issue. I would recommend if looking for a mid-priced hotel in a central Toronto location - very clean, comfortable and new.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: crewtips
Reviews.Content: I thought I was getting a deal through Expedia at US$150 a day including breakfast for my 2 day stay on June 15/16. I had clicked "pay" for this non refundable rate when I realized that there were hidden charges for an additional $100.00. There was a charge for an additional guest, the fare was for just one person!! The room is OK, though I vave seen better bedding. The bathroom is too small. The lobby is also small. As we arrived, I was wondering why the front desk girl was all rushed while we were the only ones checking in. She spoke so fast all I understood is that most everything is located on the second floor. Good enough, as it was accurate information. The place is brand new so everything works just fine. Location is good, close to nightlife, shopping, restaurants and Chinatown. Breakfast is adequate, nothing impressive. All around, we had a good stay, but at US$ 200.00 a night, I could have picked something else.

Reviews.Title: “Short walk to the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: chicchip
Reviews.Content: Brand new, affordable, well-appointed hotel only a couple of blocks away from the heart of the city. We walked to all our events, day or night. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but needs some attention to details”
Reviews.Author: Saffi_10
Reviews.Content: We prepaid for our room which was supposed to be 2 Queens, when we checked in we were told that they only had a King with sofabed left. So obviously because we checked in late they gave our room away. When we arrived at room we had no sheets for pull out couch so we had to wait on housekeeping, who were friendly. They did offer us free breakfast which was okay, a little cold but the omelets were really good.

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints!”
Reviews.Author: PositiveThinking1
Reviews.Content: I think we got one of the best value in Toronto. The room-rate of this hotel was much less expensive than others and we had a perfect stay. The descriptions of the neighborhood other reviewers made in the past are correct: there are some questionable-looking people, but that is just one of the elements of any big city.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Central Toronto Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Starry_One27
Reviews.Content: I went to The Hilton Garden Inn on Peter Street for a one night stay with my BF to celebrate our Anniversary, we opted for the King Room with Jacuzzi and Fireplace. For anyone wondering (like we were), the tub is huge, more than enough room for two people. The room itself and the hotel were very nicely decorated, combining old and new accents. We were on the 9th floor facing West and the view was so-so, but to be honest I wasn't there for the view anyway. I found it very quiet, although I did note a club directly next door with a patio, I could see the noise being a problem in the summer with nightlife in full swing. The area is FULL of restaurants and it's literally a 5 min walk from Front Street. The staff were very friendly and unintrusive, check in and check out were quick, under 5 mins. All in all, a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “can't go wrong with Hilton”
Reviews.Author: pilgrim-tabibito
Reviews.Content: Downtown Toronto for $125/night was great. I had to work a lot from my room. The comfortable ergonomic desk chair was great and free internet helped. Conveniently located with lots of great restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay !”
Reviews.Author: sunny1010_10
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was excellent! Stayed here 3 nights last weekend and I couldn't have asked for anything better. The rooms were very clean and nice. Everything was brand new and of great quality. The breakfast at the restaurant downstairs was delicious!! Although Friday and Saturday Night was a bit noisy compared to Thursday night it was tolerable. It is in a great location and in walking distance to all the entertainment in downtown Toronto!

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Downtown. A bit noisy on the weekends however”
Reviews.Author: manda33
Reviews.Content: I want to start this review and say that 80% of the stay was an excellent one. The hotel is located in a perfect spot downtown, in the Theater District/Entertainment District and was well within walking distance to some of the major attractions. The price was good, the rooms clean and the staff very friendly. They have complementary coffee in the morning downstairs (not the gross room coffee), a restaurant and fresh baked cookies in the evening. The rooms had a nice flat screen TV and a small fridge to store any items in. The parking is a bit on the steep side at $35 but I assume that this might be the going rate for most hotels in the Toronto area. There are plenty of restaurants and bars within walking distance as well as some Theaters and the Second City. However, the hotel is located right next to a nightclub. The room we had looked out onto the nightclub's back patio. We heard it on Friday night and it wasn't too loud and was tolerable. Saturday night was a different story though. The music at the nightclub was very loud until 2 AM and we heard people down at the patio screaming until 3 AM. To make matters a bit worse, there seemed to be large groups of young people there on Sat night and we had a group of very noisy neighbors. Those two things combined, the nightclub and the noisy neighbors made it a very difficult night on Saturday. To the hotel's credit, they did comp us our night for Saturday and did give us a free breakfast which was actually very tasty. We asked to move rooms first, but they did not have any available away from the nightclub. (Probably since those who complained earlier had already moved!) While I don't mind some noise in the night, the particular night we were there was not tolerable. It was probably our bad luck for being there near spring break. I would recommend this hotel for younger people who would like to be right in the middle of the Entertainment District or for those that don't mind a bit of noise or are night owls. If you are sensitive to noise, I would suggest maybe staying here during the week and not on a weekend. Overall though the rest of the stay was pleasant and the staff very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Service”
Reviews.Author: Briana1234
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Garden Inn for a week this January and found it incredible. The weekend became very busy but due to such helpful staff, my children remember Sonya and Melita for thier kindness in relocating our room and making sure we could get a peaceful sleep. The location welcomes a lot of party goers but there is no need to worry with such lovely people at the front desk to take care of you. I as well as my family would recommend this hotel to anyone with having great location and clean rooms. PLUS the great service allows you to feel comfortable in approaching with any concern you might have. A good stay is guaranteed here.

Reviews.Title: “Bring your earplugs”
Reviews.Author: DrJoeBuffalo
Reviews.Content: Stayed on a Saturday night with the family. Hotel is nice, clean, with friendly staff. But we awakened past midnight by very loud music from the nightclub next door. Clearly not the hotel's fault - but be warned.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - But not on Friday or Saturday Night”
Reviews.Author: jimmerhand
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent 3 nights at this hotel during a business trip to Toronto. Very nice & helpful staff, clean rooms and good food. That being said, now we give you the down side....if you are looking for a restful night sleep this is not your hotel! The rooms were too hot and you have no control over this! Also you are in the middle of the 'bar and club' district....with this comes VERY loud music, obnoxious crowds in the hotel and on the streets, police sirens ALL NIGHT LONG into the wee hours like 5am.....I'm just saying a restful night sleep will elude you Friday and Saturday nights. We are Hilton Honors members but can not recommend this hotel unless of course the 'party lifestyle' suites you best.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for weekend fun!”
Reviews.Author: JPinCanada
Reviews.Content: Smack in the middle of Toronto entertainment district with the Rogers Dome and CN Tower just down the street! This place was very nice and brand new. The rooms where pretty standard and had very comfortable beds. The fitness center, pool, and hot tub where all nice like I said everything was brand new. The hotel has Valet parking only which is fine since you can walk to everything. Great place to stay if you are going out to party you can walk back to the hotel. We stayed her Novemeber 13, 2009. and went out to This is London which was a 2 minute walk for us from the hotel. My only complaint is that I booked 5 rooms but when I checked in they had spread all the rooms across one floor and we all wanted the rooms side by side with some adjoining. So if you book more than one room specify you want adjoining if that what you want.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and great follow-up service following problem valet issues. I'm very impressed!”
Reviews.Author: Capital_Travelbug
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn on the weekend of Nov 20, and was truly impressed with the quality and value of this hotel. The rooms and common areas are tastefully decorated, modern and impeccably clean. The location is ideal for wandering around the downtown core of Toronto and I found the staff to be very helpful and responsive. The hotel even offers free internet service in your room and a business centre free for guests. Overall, I highly recommend staying at this hotel. The only hiccup I experienced, similar to the previous post, was the valet parking. The hotel was experiencing higher than usual volume and as such, guests were left waiting 45 minutes to an hour to retreive their car from the valet. I was frustrated, and when I returned home I wrote a letter to the manager expressing my discontentment. He immediately responded, apologized for the inconvenience and provided a credit to me for the cost of the parking. I am extremely impressed with the hotel's customer service and will stay at the Hilton Garden Inn again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms, HORRIBLE "valet" parking!”
Reviews.Author: tropical_vaca
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on Saturday, November 21st. The hotel was very nice. The rooms were fabulous! We had a room with a king bed and a couch. Nice finishings, very comfortable bed, beautiful bathrooms. I was there with three other couples and they also loved the hotel. We enjoyed a buffet breakfast at the hotel restaurant on Sunday morning and then we called the valet parking to get our cars (two cars for the 8 of us). This is where the weekend turns for the worse.... The valet ticket says to call down 30 minutes before you want to leave. When we called they said it would be 20 minutes. We went down 20 minutes later ready to go and the guy said it would be another 20 minutes! We went to wait in the lobby... we were not the only ones! The lobby was packed with people waiting for their cars. We spoke with the lady at the desk and all she had to say was "we have never had a Sunday like this... We have another valet employee coming in in an hour" Not helpful! 40 minutes later we finally got our cars. Total wait time: 1 hour. Ridiculous! We would have been back to K-W by then. Clearly they need more than two valet guys working on a Sunday morning when everyone is checking out for the weekend There was a party going on at 1-2AM beside one of our rooms. We called the front desk and it was taken care of within 15mins. Also note that there is a very busy club right next door to the entrance of this hotel. Caused a bit of noise and just a lot of people right outside the hotel entrance. (didn't bother us much as we are young and used to club crowds, but may not be best for families.) Hotel rooms and restaurant = great "Valet" = brutal and ruined the whole stay. I would recommend this hotel to anyone during the week or anyone without a car on the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Shiny and New. Good Value.”
Reviews.Author: OntarioFamilyGuy
Reviews.Content: Stayed one Saturday night while attending an event at the Metro Toronto Convention Centre. Great location, easy walking distance to Roger's Skydome, CN Tower, Conv. Centre, Theatre District. etc. Fairly new property, well appointed room, very clean with a good bed, free high speed internet and a fridge and microwave included in room. Decent toiletries and a neat walk in glass shower with multiple shower heads (big enough for two, if you are inclined) All of the staff that we came into contact with were very polite and seemed eager to please. As other's have pointed out, there are several nightclubs located nearby, and on a weekend, there is a lot of commotion in the neighbourhood but it didn't bother us. The front desk staff asked if we wanted a room on a high floor, which worked well to keep us away from the noise. It wasn't stated, but I got the impression that they were trying to keep the younger party crowd on the lower floors and the quieter folks on the upper. Many of the rooms have adjoining doors, and they aren't very soundproof. We could easily hear the people in the next room as they got ready to go out for the evening, but quite frankly it wasn't a bother and we didn't hear them come in later either. We took their Bed and Breakfast deal which included a hot breakfast in the dining room. Had a good omellete, nice choice of breads, cereal, fruit, yogurts, juices coffee etc. Had read here about the expensive parking, but we found a great underground parking lot about a block and a half south at 277 Wellington that was only $5 for the night. Pretty tricky getting into in the morning however (there was no staff on the Sunday morning) so if you use it, be sure to ask the attendant to give you the entry code for the ramp, otherwise you can't get in to get your car if the attendant is not present. During the week I imagine it is not a problem. I thought the hotel to be a good value for what we paid, and yes, it did look a bit like a hooker convention with the way some of the younger crowd were dressed heading to the clubs, but I feel that the great location more than made up for that. If you're going to be bothered with it, pay the extra $50 or $80 a night and stay down the street at the Soho Metropolitan, or over at the Hyatt on Adelaide. As someone else complained about, there is security in the lobby at night and they were controlling who came and went, but quite frankly I saw that as a definite plus. Anybody that's ever traveled to a large city like New York, Boston etc. can tell you that it's a pretty common thing these days.

Reviews.Title: “great nice clean, beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: meowmeow_9
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Booked it off priceline, and for less than 130 a night we got two double beds, a flatscreen tv, a microwave, and a fridge!!! The hotel was a bit of a walk from the Eaton Centre and shopping, but since it was summer we didnt mind, but if it wasnt sumer i definitely would have not made the walk. The hotel is right next two a few nightclubs and bars though. The people at the desk were nice, the hotel was clean and very new looking. They had an office room you could use for free but it was occupied alot....they should get more computers other than just two.....but besides that, we LOVED this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “I'm NEVER going back here... the service is the absolute worse I have ever had the misfortune of experiencing!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lilmissvixen
Reviews.Content: I had planned a night out on the town with my friends, and I thought this would be a great hotel to stay at as it is within the Hilton family. It may have been nicely decorated, but the service was terrible. First of all, the front desk clerks were not the friendliest and most attentive people. My card keys did not work and I had to get them fixed TWICE. The security guard kept track of who came and went. If there were 4 people in a room already, he would not let the rest up unless the 4 came down. So there was a huge cluster of people in the front lobby. The fire alarm went off at 3am followed by 2 very annoying loud buzzards and announcements which were difficult to understand (due to the volume). Valet was complete garbage as I waited 15 minutes for my car when I was told it was a 5 minute wait. All in all, this hotel was HORRIBLE. I've been to plenty of hotels in Toronto and I've never had an experience as bad as this.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice - good deal”
Reviews.Author: Gracefulfun
Reviews.Content: This hotel was modern, clean and well maintained. Check-in was fast and friendly. Housekeeping even stopped by to make sure we had everything we needed shortly after we arrived. The room was large, the bed was oh so comfortable, the shower was really nice and we liked having a fridge in the room. It was a bit of a walk to central downtown, but the low price for a hotel room as nice as the larger downtown hotels I have stayed in was well worth it. We had dinner at Wayne Gretzky's just down the road, and that was really nice. We would stay again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “A1 Hotel ! Club beside-unbearable !”
Reviews.Author: wildpixies
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is fabulous ! Fantastic location (OK they are renewing the old fashion district in the downtown core) but this hotel is quite wonderful ! Clean as can be, great beds, patient staff everywhere, fast elevators, great food. Downfall ? The obnoxious discobar downstairs next door ! WOW ! From the 17th floor we could be awakened from the thump thump of the disco music at 3am on a Saturday night ! OK, I love music, but this was no music ! Just bass thump ! Horrible ! Couldn't sleep in their wonderful beds ! During the week, it must be a beauitful hotel !!!!!!! But not on a Friday or Saturday night ! The week-end floozies everywhere and drunken partners are too much !

Reviews.Title: “Not prepared for business/conference travelers' needs”
Reviews.Author: Evans91
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a colleague for several nights during an academic conference at the convention centre. Nice facilityin a convenient location, very useful business services room, friendly restaurant staff (though the honeydew melon in the salad bar was off). Not a bad place for _recreational_ travelers But the desk clerks could not figure out that for business travel, two people might have two reservations to share one room -- not, as the clerks set it up, for one to be the guest of the other (which also means no "HHonors" points for the "guest). Two nights we did have a guest, who had orginally intended to attend the conference: despite being assured on the phone that we could add a rollaway for him, when he arrived, we couldn't, and he and my colleague had to split a regular bed. On checkout, the Sunday-morning clerks could not produce an itemized bill, in my name, showing a zero balance -- which my controller demands for reimbursement. Eventually they were able to fax that statement ... to my roommate, though I'd asked for one of my own. I sent a hard copy letter to the general manager suggesting this was a problem and have not received even an acknowledgment after a month. Incidentally, the valet brought up the wrong car, notwithstanding that there were probably few cars with Virginia license plates in the garage.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL BUT WATCH THE EXCHANGE RATE ! They are dishonest.”
Reviews.Author: cmpinto
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean, convenient and reasonably priced. However, when we asked about our American money they told us at the front desk that the rate difference between American and Canadian was only "a few cents" and that they only exchange one for one. So, rather than go look for a bank we went ahead and exchanged out money and gave them 40 dollars American and they gave us 40 dollars Canadian. Not until the next day after we checked out did we find out that the rate was THIRTY FIVE cents difference on each dollar and when you do the math they make a very nice profit off of unsuspecting American tourists. We trusted them to be honest and they were not. We may or may not stay here again. It was a pretty good deal but this experience left me feeling like they took advantage of me when they were supposed to be helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for it's price!”
Reviews.Author: NChaff
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a very good location. It's walking distance to restaurants and especially to CN Tower. We took one of those hop on and off tour bus and there was a stop not that far from the hotel.. We only stayed there for 1 night but we made the most out of it. The hotel staff was very nice and let us leave our luggage before and after check in so that we can go around the city. The room was very clean w/ very new furnishings. I am glad w/ Hilton Garden Inn's TV's. It's not like those old tv's from Marriott. We had bed and breakfast rate..food was really good. For the price we paid during our stay, it was really worth it. I'll stay in a Hilton Garden Inn again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great rooms, great service”
Reviews.Author: tripplanner44
Reviews.Content: I stayed here Aug 15 for one night. The front desk was very busy, but polite and apologized for the wait. I was there for a bachlorette party and had requested 2 adjoining rooms with 2 queen beds in each. The girl at the front desk was very helpful and eventhough they were very busy, was able to get us our adjoining rooms. The rooms are spacious, and clean with a mini fridge, microwave, and coffee maker. I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone who is looking to in the heart of the action. It is a 5 min walk to some of Toronto's best bars, clubs, and dining. It is also a 5 - 10 min walk to the theater district, Skydome, CN Tower, Roy Thompson Hall, and the Opera house. It is about a 15 - 20 min walk to the Eaton Centre. Yes when you get in to the hotel later at night you are questioned by the concierge what room you are in. This is because it is a very busy area at night, with all people who have just left the bars and clubs in the area so they have to make sure that some of those intoxicate people are not just wandering into the hotel. I would rather be questioned then for them to let anyone just walk in! And the Valet parking was a bit tight, but it's Toronto, and space is limited! I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who is heading to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location”
Reviews.Author: Thousandeurist
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel centrally located and no too expensive, this might be your place. It looked brand new and it was very clean, everything from room to washroom and public hotel spaces. There were a microwave and a mini fridge which was very convenient, and they actually worked. LCD TV and free internet connection at decent speed were available. Breakfast too expensive for what you got, even if the cooked food is made upon request. Try for free the delicious kind of home-made biscuits available all evenings at the front desk (or the fresh fruit in the morning for that matter) and go to grab your breakfast somewhere else. Gym is very good, and to my surprise, was empty the couple of times I went about. Donâ€™t take the limo to the airport. It cost you at least double of the standard taxi ride. Main attractions (CN Tower, Skydome) are less than 10 min walk, as they are all the theatre district amenities. You donâ€™t need a car to get the most of the city; I rather recommend you walk as much as you can, you would not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Jason789
Reviews.Content: Newish Hotel only a few blocks from the Rogers Centre and inside the Entertainment District (night club next door but no noise issues). Clean and comfortable rooms, flat screen tv and decent size bathrooms. Reception open 24 hours and free internet in the rooms a hugh bonus. Great location to base your hoilday from.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean. Centrally located. Modify the valet parking.”
Reviews.Author: 5w30
Reviews.Content: I spent a couple days in T.O. on a mini-vacation for some cycling, shopping, and the New York Yankees visiting the Blue Jays. I like squeaky clean new hotels. And this is one of them. Nice people behind the front desk, my HiltonHHonors requests were granted, and so on. Some caveats: The valet parking [only option] is $35 CAD. They use industrial-style elevators to move your car to lower floors, so trained operators are needed. Searching around for alternate parking in the area is a crapshoot, as much parking in the area [only a few blocks from the Rogers Centre/Skydome and inside the Entertainment District] is outdoors and prices are jacked up for events and weekends. I was able to jerk the system a bit by parking elsewhere and walking a couple blocks. Otherwise the room was clean [and cleaned], the fridge and microwave worked too. And the free internet is speedy. If you're there on a weekend there's a club/restaurant with music directly downstairs on the south side of the hotel. Try not to get a room on that side, even high up. I think the place is best for the business or leisure traveler that comes in via foot, cab or public transportation - the excellent trolley system is nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, Disappointing & Felt very disrespected”
Reviews.Author: 01ellie
Reviews.Content: At first i thought this was the perfect Hotel for our first trip to Toronto. The location is great, the hotel itself is fairly new so everything was clean and nicely presented. But then it was all down hill from there. First, there was absolutely no housecleaning/maid service! We were there for 4 days/3 nights and every day we had to track down a maid to request clean towels. We requested to have a maid clean our bathroom and take the trash out, no one ever came! Second, after 11pm you have to use your room card to get into the building. After swiping your card then you are questioned by someone about which room you are going to. One night, while we were coming back into the hotel, we had one guest come up to our room to visit us....but we were informed that our guest had 10 minutes!!!! and that after 10 minutes they were going to come up into our room to check if our guest was still there??!! Our guest was not spending the night only visiting us!! Third, when it was time to check out there was no bell boy to help with our bags. We were informed that we can get the cart and use it ourselves. Fourth, when we gave the valet our ticket stub he came back with the wrong car! It is not that hard to match up numbers on tickets to find a vehicle. How easy could it have been for someone else to leave with our truck if they could bring us the wrong car? Fifth, we were told there was 24 hour room service, when we inquired about room service we were told the kitchen was closed! Sixth, we were told over the phone that we could get a roll out bed (cot) for free, when we arrived we were informed that to add a roll out bed would be a fire hazard.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for a Weekend Stay in Toronto!!”
Reviews.Author: Josie83
Reviews.Content: We came to Toronto to celebrate our friend's birthday at Tryst night club (which is literally right beside the hotel!). We basically just wanted something that was close to the night club but we were very pleasantly surprised with the Hilton! The room was absolutely beautiful! Everything looked brand new and it was extremely clean. There was a microwave and a mini fridge which was very convenient. The only cons about this hotel was that check-in and check-out was extremely slow. We requested a later check out and they would not accommodate this....which I have never had happen before. Also, if you are planning on parking your car there is only valet parking available which at $35 per day is quite pricey. If you are looking for a hotel that is within walking distance of many things to do....this is the place. It was a quick walk to the shops and restaurants on Queen Street....try Fressen if you are vegetarian/vegan....its delish! We also walked to Kensington Market in 15 minutes or so.

Reviews.Title: “New, fresh, and great value”
Reviews.Author: pcgripka
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my 4-night stay at the Hilton Garden Inn Downtown very much. The hotel is ideally located for a weekend nightclub getaway, though it's not too bad for business or general sightseeing (as it's within walking distance of the subway and very close to 3 streetcar lines). The hotel is new and nicely decorated, but with a comfortable, relaxed atmosphere. My room was very quiet and had a nice view of the city. The bed was great, the free high-speed internet worked very well, and the microwave and refrigerator were convenient. The staff was uniformly polite and friendly. Perhaps because the hotel is so new and not as well-known as others in the area, I was able to get a very good rate (under $100), which made it a fantastic value. And I loved the complementary fresh-baked cookies in the afternoon, a unexpected tasty perk.

Reviews.Title: “Good for one night maybe a weekend - great value for money”
Reviews.Author: only1kadee
Reviews.Content: We had 2 rooms that were on the same floor but not next door to each other so my mother and 2 children were in one and we and the third child were in the other. Our visit was to go to the baseball game and the proximity to rogers center is great, a short walk. For the price it is great value and th best part is the breakfast, great service and food. Is it something special no, but was it comfortable for one night yes. We are good sleepers so the nightclub next door wasn't an issue for us as reported by others, but we did have to ask reception to move the group of people who kept congrigating in the corridors to move along when it was approaching midnight. This was done and thanks to the staff for this. The rooms were normal size and beds comfy, not enough linen in the room for the sofa beds (in either room). The valet parking is very steep but unavoidable. Staff were very friendly, thumbs up you guys.

Reviews.Title: “Nice new hotel in the Entertainment District”
Reviews.Author: george00
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the new Hilton Garden Inn Toronto Downtown for 3 days in July. We chose the hotel based on the price and location. It is located in the entertainment district, close to clubs, bars, restaurants, theater, Rogers Center and the CN Tower. While it is a few blocks from the subway, there are streetcar stops at the end of the street. The staff was always very friendly. The lobby, pool area, rooms and hallway were all very clean. The pool and hottub are small, luckily there was only one other person there when we used the facilities. The room has a refrigerator and microwave. Wireless internet is free which is always appreciated. Parking is valet only (would prefer the option to self park). Overall, a great stay and I would definitely stay there again, especially in the summer when there are tons of nearby patios to explote.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean - NOT quiet”
Reviews.Author: RangersMom3boys
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Toronto for weekend Jay's game and visit the Hockey Hall of Fame. The location of the hotel is excellent for these attractions. Very easy to get to - but parking is an issue and the rate of $35.00 / day is very steep. Valets were excellent with our vehicle. The front desk was very curtious and all the staff always said hello. BUT ..... there is a new night club beside the hotel called "Tryst" .... needless to say it is techno music and it is all you can hear until about 3:00 in the morning ... especially in the summer when they have their patio open and are projecting video's on the side of the building. This was a saturday night - I do not know if it is the same any other night of the week, but I would definitely ask to stay on the north side of the hotel and up higher if I ever travelled there again. We complained the next morning and they said we should have complained the night of ... but other people we talked to said that they did complain and nothing happened.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAFF!!!! Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Johanne514
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great HGI hotel. The staff were super friendly. Hotel was very clean and well maintained. GREAT location! walking distance to the CN tower. STAFF were sooo helpful.. from the valet to the front desk. alll the staff were so nice and took the extra step to make it a great stay. I would definately go back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great HGI”
Reviews.Author: Misk15
Reviews.Content: We always use Hilton famliy hotels, and Hilton Garden Inn is my favorite. They have great rates, and works good for all purposes. We decided to sleep at the newly opened HGI Toronto Downtown. Good location, walking distance to all major attractions in Toronto. The hotel is brand new, fantastic rooms and public areas. Nice little indoor pool as well. Breakfast was splendid as usual at Hilton Garden Inn. Custom made omelets, with several side dishes and great selection of juice, milk, cereals and fruits. Possible to make your own waffle as well. Only con during the stay was that the hotel didn't provide cellphone chargers, since I had lost my converter and had to buy another one.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location and price!”
Reviews.Author: juliea344
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2-night stay at this hotel for a little getaway with the husband and kids. It was so inexpensive for the area and amenities. Service was fast and friendly. Rooms are attractive and well-appointed with super comfortable beds We were traveling light and didn't bring our laptops so the business center with free internet was a definite plus. The lobby has delicious cookies every afternoon. The indoor pool and hot tub are nice and we had the whole area to ourselves when we went. After checkout the hotel kept our baggage for us so we could spend the day in Toronto without having to lug it around. The 15-minute walk to Union Station is very easy and convenient. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Valet lost key! Experience went downhill from there.”
Reviews.Author: decram
Reviews.Content: Valet lost the key to our Mercedes Benz! We had to rent a car and travel back to US to have key made. Spent all Sunday morning making phone calls to figure situation out. Hotel did not offer taxi that day so I had to walk and pulled my back out. The rental agency was farther than they said, and my back got worse. Am currently seeking medical attention for it. Many parties going on in hotel with loud music and screaming. At 10:30 requested we get different room. Hotel comped our room, but then double charged us. Had to spend much time fixing their error. Key cards kept deactivating so we had to go up and down elevator several times to have it reactivated. My husband had to drive back following week to Toronto from US after having been on the road for work for four days, to get our car back, that had been sitting underground under the hotel. Hotel offered lunch and room. Also offered professional driver to get car back. We did not feel comfortable putting matters in their hands. All in all, the hotel never bent backwards to compensate for our time involved making calls, getting key made, needing time off work,and driving back. We were extremely inconvenienced (mother in law in hospital). Rob Roy, Manager of hotel said he would call early last week to compensate. Never heard back. Have placed several calls to him. He has not called back. The Intercontinental offered the same rate at this hotel. Unfortunately, we made the wrong decision on where to stay. I would NOT recommend giving this hotel your business.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - great hotel”
Reviews.Author: webjanet
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week while on vacation. The hotel is new, modern, clean and steps from everything in Toronto. CN Tower, and all of downtown are blocks away. Steps from great places to eat on King Street and a short 2 blocks from Queen Street shops. ABout 500 yards from Gretzky's restaurant, Second City and more. Don't miss the Calphalon Culinary Centre on Spadina and the wonderful Kensington Market a short walk down Spadina. The reviewer who said this isn't the 'best part of town' doesn't know anything about Toronto - this is the BEST part of town! We got the room WITH breakfast for the same price as without and it was a great idea -- breakfast is fabulous with made-to-order meals every morning! Friendly staff and the chef was walking around checking on patrons. Really great.
